Reviews.Title: “A nice downtown Westin”
Reviews.Author: Randy W
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had some time to kill so we decided to stay downtown prior to a long flight out the following day and enjoy some of the Chicago flavor. I was a little concerned when the doorman was absent and I wondered if I'd have to abandon the rental car at the curb to check in but another employee at the hotel stepped up and said that the doorman was detained but he would watch our car while we checked in. We checked in with no problems at all, dropped our luggage off and left to go see the city. We actually didn't get a lot of time to see the property and its amenities but the staff were very helpful and the room was clean. Hope to come back to enjoy some of the other highlights the hotel has to offer, it seems to be very well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice choice in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Ashley A
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Westin twice now, and both times I had a very good experience. The hotel itself is quite nice, the lobby has a nice relaxing yet fun feel to it, and the rooms that I stayed in were very nice. The beds were very comfortable and adorned with nice white bedding. This last time we stayed in a one bedroom suite- which was really nice (marble in the bathrooms, nice furniture, comfy beds, mini bar). This Westin has a simplistic but high end feel to it. I have stayed a few other places in Chicago but I love the Westin Michigan Avenue because it is right on Magnificent Mile and close to a lot of attractions (Hancock tower is literally right across the street too). It is also very decently priced for a Magnificent Mile hotel. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit Chicago. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: cleorio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to everything downtown, particularly shopping and restaurants, but you should know that it is outside "the loop" of the downtown area (whatever that is...). Easy walk to the "El" trains as well. The room was on the small side, but very clean overall and nicely decorated. A problem with our air conditioning was fixed immediately. I was on the 15th floor at a conference rate, so it was somewhat cheaper - but better quality - than other conference-rate rooms I have had. We used the spa, which was of course overpriced, but the options and the service were great. See "Corrine" and check out the massage with the hot towels and optional scalp/foot therapy as well. Although overpriced, it was worth it. The fitness center also was well-supplied, had several machines, and had space every time I went by. Regarding the conference, I was not disappointed. The meeting spaces were the perfect temperature (They are usually too cold, even for a warmblooded person like me), and there were ample supplies. I was not a fan of the "green" aspect of the hotel, which offers you the option to eschew the daily cleaning of your room for a $5 voucher. NOT worth it!! Also, the lotion/shampoo/soap were not replaced until we had used them all. I like to conserve, but you do expect a fancy hotel to be, well, FANCY. We ate often in the Grill associated with the hotel. Food was good, but the whole place was way expensive. Expect to pay about twice the price of what you'd pay at home for a drink in a bar. We also used the mini-bar during our stay. It was never restocked. Just as well, but still... Also, the ice bucket was not clean upon arrival, nor was it ever emptied or cleaned afterward. I think the staff attentiveness is the "downside" of this hotel. Longish waits to check in and check out, and the area where you leave your bags after you check out (and before you leave for the airport) was not watched at all. We entered and left the area several times to access our bags and were not stopped!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Mag Mile”
Reviews.Author: MMMPye
Reviews.Content: This was a great trip, the hotel was clean, friendly & pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Westin, I think not!”
Reviews.Author: Nafatli027
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. The service from the moment you walk-in is horrific. There is not one an attendant who is willing to help you with your luggage. You schlep your luggage after waiting in line for 15 minutes. Once you walk-in to your room, you are welcomed by outdated furniture with poor linens. Waldorf Astoria is offering best rate for $ 178. Should have done it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, very easy”
Reviews.Author: Matthew H
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for shopping, close to many excellent restaurants, easy check-in and -out, stunning lake views if you are on the right side of the building, very comfortable bed, terrific shower (excellent pressure!). What is not to like? If you require a very fancy spa, stay at the W instead. The valet parking is on the expensive side at $59/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-reasonable price (In Winter)”
Reviews.Author: dvmharris
Reviews.Content: Awesome location for those interested in Michigan Ave. Hotel is a little...um, let's just say not on par with the great Westins we all know and love. Chopped up spaces--wall-paper peeling in spots! But easily over looked if location is what you are after.

Reviews.Title: “one night stand”
Reviews.Author: bighurt56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a quick trip into Chicago for a one night stay at the Westin. She wanted to do some shopping on Michigan Avenue and the restaurants downtown never disappoint. Room was clean, service at the desk was polite and Marina, the concierge, was very helpful. She made dinner reservations for us at Francesca's and put us at a table with a waiter she knew who was also just as great. A quick, but great one day getaway

Reviews.Title: “adequate place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lala6
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine in all regards. A very big & busy lobby, full of tours and groups. The double room was clean & quiet but the ice maker on our floor (preferred status) was broken and there seemed to be no advantage to the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking...”
Reviews.Author: STURGISFAMILY
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to celebrate a friend's 40th Birthday with an overnight stay in Chicago. Having stayed in Westins prior to this, we were anticipating everything to be perfect; it was far from that. We reserved two rooms (Kings) and requested the rooms be either together or atleast near each other and that the have a view of Michigan Ave. The first of the two rooms was ready by the desigated check in time of 3:00; However the second room was not ready until 5:00! The first room assigned to us (1418) was unacceptable with paint peeling off the ceiling in the bathroom. This was not how I remember a quality Westin hotel. We were assigned a new room on the 15th floor; our friends were assigned a room on the 14th floor as we were told our request to have our rooms together could not be accommodated but they could offer us a late check out of 2PM. I will say as a concession, a bottle of Champagne was placed in their room which was a much appreciated gesture. When you say "Westin", you think "Heavenly Bed"...we had the very comfortable bed but we couldn't sleep because of all the chaos in the halls. Security had to be called to the room next to us for a loud disagreement and then 3am and 4am...loud and obnoxious "guests" in the hallways (aka drunk/rude people who show no respect for others)...I could hear other frustrated guests threatening to call Security. On another note, we were shocked by the way our vehice was driven in our presence...The valet drove our vehicle recklessly in the garage. I gasped watching him "gun it" in reverse; certain that he came within inches of hitting the wall. Overall, there was no warm and fuzzy feeling here from the staff...more like...sorry, but there's nothing we can do...So..like I said, if I were you and I was considering staying at this particular Westin, I would keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Professional Staff!”
Reviews.Author: SamuraiYosh
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night at the Westin on Michigan Avenue in Chicago. Was really happy with the location. All the shopping you could ever want is within walking distance. The Water Tower mall was right across the street as was the John Hancock observation deck attraction. What really struck me about the Westin was the staff. From the concierge, the front desk and the bellboys, it was very professional and helpful. Thanks for making our stay awesome. Beds were one of the most comfortable I have had in a hotel. Also, the lobby was amazing for people watching as there were tons of chairs and couches to hang out on. Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Weekend Ever”
Reviews.Author: Lynn A
Reviews.Content: This was by far one of the best hotel weekends I've ever had. We were here for a charity function and between our location and the friendly staff and the most amazing room with a view of Michigan Ave, I couldn't have asked for anything more. The beds are indeed "heavenly"; our room was spacious and very clean. Let's not forget the very friendly and helpful staff. We had room service and our food was again just amazing. We enjoyed the breakfasts every morning. If you want to experience the downtown feel of Chicago this is the place to be. Thank you to everyone at the Westin for making our stay so memorable. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: racerBrazil
Reviews.Content: Confortable and clean. great confort, good beds, clean, nice staff. A bit overpriced. Parking is a scam US$60 PER DAY !!!!

Reviews.Title: “not worthy of the westin name”
Reviews.Author: chicabianca
Reviews.Content: great, great location. but this place just does not stand up to the Westin name. Rooms are big, this is good, but they do need redecoration, painting the walls and a touch of the luxury one would expect from a westin hotel. The outside of the building is modern, while the inside is more like a 3 class hotel. Staff is just ok. Free internet in the lobby, breakfast rich but not high quality. Stayed there during a congress and the hotel was so crowded and fuzzy...

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: southamericandude
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on 2/11 and we really liked it. The room is roomy compared to other hotels in downtown chicago. the bed was very comfy and the location is excellent. I bought the stay and parking package and it was great cause you can come in and out up to 4 times in a day without having to pay extra. Considering how expensive is parking in Chicago, it was a great deal. I beleive parking alone is $50 but for the package it only adds $30 extra. The only bad thing at the hoteal is that they chrage for wireless. For parking you just need to drop your car in the same block where the hotel is located and they park it for you. When you need your car you need to dial an ext # and they bring your car. Depending on the time, it can take up to 20mins(especially when people check out after noon). I recommend this hotel. Oh the restaurant in there is very expensive. For chicken nuggets it was $14.50

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: GMT80
Reviews.Content: Great, comfortable, clean, well presented hotel with good friendly staff. Not far from shopping areas and right across the road from the John Hancock Center. Itâ€™s about a 10min walk to the nearest train station. Breakfast was good but wasnâ€™t all that cheap, however there are other options close-by to go for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - GREAT bed!”
Reviews.Author: FinnOnTheFly
Reviews.Content: An excellent spot to stay in Chicago. Right on Michigan Ave, close to the lake, close to Rush street. Lots of shopping, restaurants, theatre (we saw Million Dollar Quartet at the Apollo - wow!) and lots of sights. A very comfortable room, good staff , we will be back. Didn't try their restaurant, but that was just because we were out and about so much. We will get there, especially if we stay longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable stay! Will definitely return some day...”
Reviews.Author: Gazpacho16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin on Michigan Avenue with my parents when visiting Chicago in 2002. It is a fantastic hotel, with modern decor and absolute high class service! From the moment you enter the lobby you immediately feel the Westin touch. The front desk agents were competent and professional and I will never forget the impact the Doorman had on our stay! He was always smiling and seemed to absolutely love his job... The Westin on Michigan Ave. is a must stay for anyone whoÂ´s visiting Chicago! It is centrally located, and offers great value for 5-star service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Typical Westin Room”
Reviews.Author: Winecharmer
Reviews.Content: While I usually stay in the other Westin (River North) because it's closer to where I do business in town, that was all booked up this time. And I'm glad it was, because the Michigan Avenue location is vastly nicer than the River North. Loads of great restaurants and shopping nearby. Make sure to hit Ditka's for the Pot Roast nachos! Back to the Westin... outstanding service upon arrival, including accomodating my incredibly early check-in (9 AM). Typical Westin room, but among the more-recently updated hotels. Everything was where it was supposed to be, and nice and clean. Only annoying thing was my noisy neighbor, who I could hear through the wall. But that means he could hear me, too. Meh. Had a great view looking straight up at the Hancock Tower, which is right next door. Take the $15 ride to the top. Worth it for the spectacular view. Great restaurant downstairs with an amazing and affordable wine list. Not sure if they had any kind of happy hour. Lobby was always busy. No free coffee other than in-room; coffee stand in the lobby sells Starbucks but isn't a Starbucks. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “westin chicago”
Reviews.Author: stanleytwo
Reviews.Content: recently visited the westin chicago on a family trip.myself,wife and our grown children for my wifes birthday.i booked 2 rooms and when we arrived they gave us 2 adjoining rooms,which worked really well. hotel was spotless and we had no complaints at all,from doorman to bellhops to desk clerk,all went out of their way to accomodate.we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “$57 Parking - YIKES”
Reviews.Author: z75
Reviews.Content: The room was average. The bathroom was tiny and the water did not drain. It was very warm in the room because the thermostat did not work. The worst part was the $57 we paid for parking. Fortunately, we did not spend much time in the room. We stayed there on New Year's Eve, so we were out most of the night and left first thing in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Will S
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night a few days after Christmas this year, and had a very comfortable and pleasant stay. Aside from the overnight parking being on the expensive side (~$60/night), we paid a fair price for our room. All of the staff was friendly and knowledgeable, with the exception of an older guy in the lobby helping with bags. The location is fantastic with endless shopping and tourist attractions right outside your front door. Room was peaceful and quiet with cool views of the John Hancock building. Excellent salmon grilled cheese sandwich for room service breakfast!! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StanClement
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at any number of places in downtown Chicago so to better enjoy the fine dining, clubs and plays...but I was really impressed by this newly refurbished Westin. In addition to it being right in the middle of the action (across from the Hancock Building), they featured a weekend rate of $109 which included parking (a $57 value in itself). Nice large room, newly remodeled, flat screen TV, extra sitting chairs...very nicely appointed. Recommend it as a great weekend spot to stay, or for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, nice tavern”
Reviews.Author: bsedor
Reviews.Content: An older Westin but very nice. Super customer service. Good restaurant with good service also.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Chalioth
Reviews.Content: The location of the westin Michigan avenue was great, but any other than that I would not recommend this hotel. The lady who check us in was rude and very unfriendly. The other staff we ran into were on the other hand very nice and polite. Our neighbors were very loud and obnoxious well into the night.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerously Close to Shopping Mecca”
Reviews.Author: missed_connection
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room here for New Year's Eve. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is beautiful, perhaps as a result of a recent renovation. Our room was very comfortable and we loved the nice linens and pillows. The bed was super comfy! This is the perfect place to stay if you want easy walking access to the best shopping Chicago has to offer. The only thing that did not go too smoothly was the valet parking. It seemed like they had a backlog of cars and we waited about a half an hour to get our car. I think it was due to some other guest who was having a fit about something, but it would have been nice to get him to move his car so others could get out. Oh, and it costs $57.00 to park there. Can't really complain about the price. It's Chicago; you're gonna pay to park no matter where you stay. We will definately come back to this hotel again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing everything”
Reviews.Author: HelloK8e
Reviews.Content: Me & three of my friends stayed in a hotel room - they didn't even have a pet fee!- They brought a portable fridge to the room, which was really nice. The hot tub stayed open until midnight, we took full advantage. Also, they let us check in early & check out at 2pm the next day. We also ate at the restaurant downstairs, it was really good! I'll absolutely stay here again...not to mention the wonderful heavenly bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for New Years”
Reviews.Author: Amootrav
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal here for New Year's Eve. It's right next to the Hancock Building so it was a fantastic location. It felt awesome to just walk outside and immediately start shopping on Michigan Avenue. The decor of the lobby was nice, and I enjoyed being able to get Starbucks coffee from a cafe downstairs in the lobby. The shower pressure was nice, and the bed was very comfortable. What more could you ask for for from a hotel with a great location and a sweet deal?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel BUT!!”
Reviews.Author: AnitaK1
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice and comfortable Clean Hotel...But...Why do they charge you to park in their Parking lot? for what they charge per room the fees for parking is Ridiculous! and we did not get room cleaning either...we had to pay for that as well. Would we stay there again??? Well we will probably find a place with free parking and maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice Hotel, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Lucy1201
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, clean, and in a prime location on North Michigan Ave (Right across from Water Tower Place.) This was a family vacation, and our stay began on Christmas Day and contintinued through the week. The service, especially during the first three days of our stay, was outstanding. The only complaint that we have is that, as the week went on - and the hotel got busier -- the service got a little lax. (Housekeeping "forgot" to make our beds one day.. and it took over an hour for a maintenance engineer to come fix a minor issue.) However, the manager was very apologetic and did his best to make good on the problems. Overall, I would certainly recommend this hotel for both families and business travelers - and we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and well-located”
Reviews.Author: halfcafqueen
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a 3-day stay at the Westin. The room was very nicely decorated and well-maintained. We used the fitness center a couple times; the room had a nice assortment of cardio machines; weight equipment was a bit less represented and weights were all too heavy for my ability. The hotel is on Michigan Ave, next door to the John Hancock building, and one block away from the Watertower Place -- a great location for shoppers. Staff was friendly and fairly efficient at check-in. We didn't see too much more hotel staff, except for the maids, who were knocking on doors around 9:00 AM. Late sleepers, be sure to put your do not disturb sign on the doorknob!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & great location”
Reviews.Author: dkcoll
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful......luxury, clean, great big rooms, friendly staff, great location. Would highly recommend this to travellers.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a deal here, go for it!”
Reviews.Author: doctorgooz
Reviews.Content: I stumbled into a deal for a room here for $95 on the Monday after Christmas. That is quite the deal! While not the top of the line in terms of Westins (dull lobby, smallish rooms) you still get the Heavenly Bed and Shower and are right across the street from the John Hancock building on North Michigan Avenue. Its one of the best locations in Chicago. By the way, they charge something like $55 a day for parking - you can park a block away on Walton for $29 a day. Bottom line, if you find a weekend or off season rate that even approaches this, jump on it. On a quality to value ratio, this deal was hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Below average Westin, Good location”
Reviews.Author: plantagenet_101
Reviews.Content: Enjoy the shopping, restaurants and sites near this well-situated hotel because the rooms and service at this Westin are disappointingly average. Stained comforters, yellow-ish pillows peeking out from their cases, motel-style bathroom and amenities, confused staff (unable to locate a map of the city)... Glad this one was on my husband's platinum points.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION - AVERAGE WESTIN”
Reviews.Author: TravelinLeather
Reviews.Content: If you get a great rate and are looking for a fantastic location on michigan avenue but expect nothing more, then this is the hotel for you. I stood in line to check in around 4:30pm on a Friday night and finally made it to the front desk 30 mins later. There were huge lines in the lobby and only 3 front desk staff. If you have any status at this hotel they seem not to care (I'm Platinum) and didn't offer any recognition or increased level of service. For Gold and Patinum members, there is not a lounge offered at this hotel. Parking is $57 per day which is typical of other hotels right on Michigan avenue in downtown chicago and that cost is listed on their website if you look for it. It's just something to be aware of. There are also plenty of parking garages around the hotel and if you don't mind walking a few blocks you can park for $38 or so if you leave it parked and dont need it to get around. I feel this hotel completely relies on its location to keep people coming back. If you are looking for a luxury experience you will be disappointed and should choose another hotel. This almost feels like an airport property. If you want other options check out the Sofitel Water Tower (my favorite), Palomar, and Omni in the same general area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaptHemo
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the locaion for this hotel. Close to everything and convenient. Clean hotel andvery comfortable. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....”
Reviews.Author: JGD35
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed, clean room, nice bath and that's about it. Very small room and VERY noisy neighbors. Would we stay again? Probably not. There was nothing that inspired that 'we must come back here' feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for an excellent location, satisfactory value given the amenities”
Reviews.Author: Mikhail384230
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property to attend a conference at a nearby hotel for which the nightly rate was cost prohibitive. I was very pleased with my choice as the room was clean, had comfortable beds, and offered a good workspace. My room also looked to have an updated bathroom and I was impressed with the spacious closet. Check-in and check-out were both speedy, and the front desk and bell staff were prompt, polite, and attentive. The location of this hotel is its strongest attribute, with a short walk, bus, or train ride to the heart of The Loop, and numerous retail and sightseeing destinations just outside its doors. While I did not have a lake view in my room, the view of Michigan Avenue in December was equally pleasing. That being said I did have some critical points. First, the room service menu was expensive even by downtown Chicago standards with numerous surcharges. The food was steakhouse fare and sounded good, but the restaurant was packed and I had arrived late at night after a long day of work and travel and would have preferred to relax with something light. Fortunately there are lots of restaurants within a few blocks so I took the opportunity to venture elsewhere. Second, I would have preferred free wi-fi in the hotel room. There was free wi-fi available in the lobby, but it was always crowded and did not offer any work spaces suitable for anything beyond checking email. They also took to piping loud pop Christmas music. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a comfortable and basic stay in the Streeterville/Gold Coast area, but does not necessarily need the high levels of amenities or the glitz of a Four Seasons/Drake/Ritz Carlton as you spend more time on the town and less time in the room. It is probably a little more Sheraton than Westin, but that is not necessarily a demerit if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Finally burnt out on this property”
Reviews.Author: DRBillJ
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there numerous times when visiting Chicago on the holidays. While it has the advantage of North Michigan avenue, shopping and all, it reminds me of a worn out airport hotel. Elevators are slow, front desk queue can be long, hallways are dingy, lobby is not very inviting, and noise travels freely from room to room and from hallway to room. There is no easy way to fix these issues. Even as a loyal and top tier Starwood guest, we have selected another brand for this Christmas. I suggest that Starwood downgrade the property, sell it, or invest in a proper remodel.

Reviews.Title: “More a Hampton Inn than a Westin”
Reviews.Author: Bus_Travel_TX
Reviews.Content: We arrived today, looking forward to a wonderful weekend of Christ,as shopping. The Westin location could not be better. Check in was quick and friendly. That's where the positives end. The first room had a door that would not close. We were relocated to another room, that was much smaller ans had a lovely view of a brick wall from the building next door outside. A platinum SPG memb, we called down to ask again if there was a more suitable room. The front desk manager offered to send someone up with a key to yet another room. New waited a while and the key never came. The rooms are very old... with peeling wallpaper and old, worm carpet. Never the heavenly bed that we have come to know and love was worn and tired. It really did remind us more of a roadside discount hotel than a big city luxury hotel. In the end, we left and crossed the street to stay at the Four Seasons. I am a loyal Starwood client, but think this Westin is past it's prime.

Reviews.Title: “Doing the right thing...”
Reviews.Author: Pocasset1
Reviews.Content: Wow, talk about customer service.. With family in tow, I checked in assuming I had a reservation. I did have a reservation, but it was for the week before. So with the computer systems done, and a long line behind me (and a tired family of travelling), Nurper Oztok did the right thing!! She made sure i had the room for the stay, regardless of my "daddy" error. Again, Wow doing the right thing when it comes to customer service. Thank you Nurper!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff could care less”
Reviews.Author: CAcowboy
Reviews.Content: This was he worst hotel experience I have ever had. The staff was more interested in telling each other stories than even acknowledging the clients. When you entered the hotel, most of them would be standing around chatting with each other. Didn't even bother to answer questions. The hotel itself is dirty and falling apart. I have stayed here many times in the past but never again.

Reviews.Title: “No Luxury Starwood Choices in Downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: BOLDMissionHills_KS
Reviews.Content: As a platinum Starwood Members, we just completed our third stay at the Westin Michigan Avenue Hotel. As a Starwood Member, you have several hotel choices when staying in downtown Chicago: Westin River North, Sheraton Chicago, W City Center, W Lakeshore, Four Points, and Termont Chicago. We have stayed in all of these SPG properties except the Termont (which is a newly acquired Starwood property). Overall, the Westin Michigan Avenue is a solid average hotel. It is your second best choice when staying at a Starwood property. Your best choice is the Westin River North. Here's some back-up information on our decision. Location - This hotel has the best location of any Starwood property in downtown. It is just steps from some of the best shopping in Chicago. Some of the higher rooms even have a lake view. Update Grades - As SPG Platinum Members, we have been upgraded during all of our stays. We were accommodated with wine, fresh fruit, and other amenities. This hotel treats their Starwood members very well. Clean and Well Maintained - Even though this property is older, it is clean and fresh. Rooms are updated and maid service is excellent. Rooms - We were given a suite with an adjoining bedroom during our recent stay. Large flat screen TV's and signature Westin bed were great. Starbuck's coffee and quick one cup coffee makers were handy. Refurbished gym was nice as it provided more options for tread mills, elliptical, and bikes plus free weights Hotel windows were older, leaked air and need replacement. Shower plumbing was noisy and water pressure was poor. We noticed their signature double headed shower heads no longer exist. Customer Service - Concierge was either not available or just not there. General phone service took several minutes to pick up. Bellmen seemed non attentive and not engaging with the guests. Please note it was Thanksgiving week which may have contributed to the less than noteworthy service. In summary, Chicago has some of the best hotels in the world. Unfortunately, if you're a loyal Starwood member, you have no luxury choices. No St Regis or Luxury Collection hotels exist. It time for Starwood to provide their members these options. We would like to suggest the conversion of the Westin Michigan Avenue as the first luxury SPG Hotel in the Downtown Chicago area. This hotel has the location and building to be a wonderful luxury hotel, however, in it's current state, it is just another average hotel

Reviews.Title: “Solid Westin hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Avataarkaap
Reviews.Content: I generally enjoy being at the Westin, and this time was no different. The proximity to the Apple Store and Best Buy were quite useful, and I walked to the office at the Merchandise Mart in the morning, stopping at the Starbucks along the way. I was treated well, and had a spacious room. No complaints here... Ooh - and of course the Heavenly Bed never disappoints!

Reviews.Title: “perfect view of Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: hummer2407
Reviews.Content: I recently finished a stay at the Westin Michigan Avenue. This was the third time I have stayed at this hotel. This was the best of the 3 stays. The checkin was fast and friendly. We stayed in a Crowne Suite. This suite was huge. The suite was on the corner of the building allowing you a view of both North Michigan Av and South Michigan Av. The rooms were quiet and clean. I have to admit that my previous stays at this property were problematic, but the management has addressed these concerns and has done a good job improving customer service. I called for my car and by the time I made it downstairs it was waiting for me. I did not have to wait to be checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but tired inside.”
Reviews.Author: jd294
Reviews.Content: The location worked very well, and my room was clean and quiet. However, the decor was tired compared to other Westins, and the amenities were fewer or of lesser quality. The pub restaurant downstairs doesn't serve the typical health-focused Westin menu, and the quality of room service food was poor (e.g., my oatmeal arrived cold). One morning I opted for a muffin at the Cafe A La Carte, but it was brick-hard and too stale to eat. All in all, this place is just fine but not worthy of a recommendation or return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Mutiny
Reviews.Content: I was here for 3 nights on business and the conference facilities were very good. I think the location on the Magnificent Mile is pretty hard to beat - great shopping and restaurants are all very close by. The bed was super comfy, the room was a good size and the bathroom was clean and uncluttered. The bench top in the bathroom is a little too low for someone over 5'10". I am an SPG member and therefore I get free internet in my room, which really helped me stay in touch with the office. Service at breakfast was friendly and prompt, although I found it strange that there was no buffet breakfast - only an a la carte menu. The only real downside appears to be the ever present queues at reception both checking in and checking out at all times of the day and I think it is because they seem to have staff on computers at reception who never seem to deal with customers.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous. The best definition of the word.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel W
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting in my room as I type this, right next to the elevator, which has been going non-stop. Of course, when I came into the room, the fan was on full time, so I didn't realize it until I turned the fan off. $300/night, I get to hear the elevator running all night. Can't switch rooms as they're booked full, and won't be able to move us until tomorrow. Freaking brilliant. The room itself is dated. Average size, but nothing like the other Westins I've stayed at. The lake view is obstructed quite well by another building, so even on the top floor, it's kind of a letdown. Don't get your hopes up. To top it off, when I checked in, their system was down and the line was 50 deep. Not exactly a pleasant way to start the weekend, and it's seemingly getting steadily worse. I hope to be able to update this review at a later date with something positive, but as for now, this is a rather gut-wrenching experience from a hotel chain I was once quite fond of. EDIT. Got worse. So after my guests arrived and an extremely confusing discussion with the front desk and valet, we were informed that self-park and valet were two completely different things owned by different companies. Which would have been fine, but by the time we learned this, there were cars backed behind us and we had virtually no option but to pay the $57/night valet. Further, I was told I'd get a better room the second night, and after calling to confirm in the morning, was informed that there was no other room available. So, yet another strike against them. We opt to grin and bear it. Finally, get back to the hotel later that night, and decide to shower - when dark brown water with black specks comes out of the spout. After calling the front desk, 30 minutes later an engineer shows up to tell us that they changed a pump and we can go ahead, as things were now "fine". Wonderful, we really wanted to wait until 2 A.M. to brush our teeth. 4 star hotel my... I'm no longer staying at Westin until they rectify this. $700.+ for a two night stay which was no better than a Super 8? Ridiculous. Forgot one thing - another EDIT - went to the GRILL at Westin for breakfast. Took over 30 minutes to get our breakfast after ordering. That's a long time for $15 French Toast... right?

Reviews.Title: “Great location...not much else”
Reviews.Author: klockdj
Reviews.Content: We will never stay there again. We were promised and paid for a view of Michigan Ave to watch the lights festival parade,however they failed to explain their definition of 'view' was actually a side view. Plus they promised free internet but when we got home and reviewed our bill, they had tagged us $11.31 3 different times on our bill. I called to complain and they adjusted it for me but it should have never been there in the first place. Make sure you check your bills thoroughly if you decide to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but no, I'd probably would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: bonzia4617
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a four star expecting 4 star experience in a big city. Well, not so much. Not once could we ring directly through to the concierge desk ALWAYS VOICEMAIL, although they did call us back later....we could not hear them over the traffic. Thank God I wasn't counting on them for tickets to a show! So no Spa Days for us! We couldn't get through! Also, we were told by the booking agent at Westin to again request hypoallergenic pillows upon arrival. We did. We did NOT receive them, was informed THEY WERE OUT. We are all highy allergic to Down so we got stuck sleeping on our clothes and clean towels for the duration of our stay. Heavenly bed? Not so much!! They were very accommodating to our doggies, in fact were quite sweet. When they made a mistake on my bill and overcharge me over $300 it only took a quick trip to the front desk to have it fixed. Food was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “very expensive and in need of repair”
Reviews.Author: craigsmithdc
Reviews.Content: stayed here 4 nights for business. was definitely gouged on price. doors were chipped, room was small and uninspiring. advertised marble bathroom- very disappointing. poor service. will not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location..but not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shmemmie
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel for a wedding-they had rooms blocked off. i had called the concierge about 10 times before i got there at different times of the day to ask a few questions. every time i called i got a vm, never a person. when i arrived, the doormen were lovely. i had to wait 15 minutes to check in. they only had 2 people working the front desk on a friday of a buzy weekend. i was told i was on a "preferred guest" floor. still not sure what that means. my room was very spacious, especially since i was by myself. however, the carpet was getting threadbare...it was shreeded where it met the tile. the bathroom was very small. if you sat on the toilet-you had to close the door or you had to sit sideways. you also had to jump over the toilet to get in and out of the shower. and, water would spray on the toilet and make it wet. some of the guests were kinda loud. if you are a light sleeper it may not be the best place for you. the morning after i arrived, i went to the concierge to ask a question. the girl there acted like she was doing me a favor by getting me a phone number. instead of asking if she could confirm my appointments for me, she handed me the phone numbers on a post it, barely acknowledging me. i was told at check in that i had free wifi in my room. i went to download something on my nook and i had to sign in with a charge. i couldnt find a "front desk" button on my phone, so i dialed customer service. i asked about the free wifi. the women acted, again, like she was doing me favor. she wouldnt look up my room # to see if it was free. she said, 'if they told you free wifi then it is". Thanks for your help. i will say that housekeeping was lovely and helpful, even thought they didnt replinsh what i had used, but i had found it on the cart so it was fine. the location of this hotel cannot be beat; block from lakeshore drive, across the street from the hancock tower, across from bloomies and the mall at 900, right on michigan ave. it was a perfect location for me, as all my wedding events were at the 4 seasons across the street. i am very disapppointed with this hotel and would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “near all good things”
Reviews.Author: roamfamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited Chicago many times, but this stay was for bringing our 2 daughters for the first time. The Westin was, as you would expect, a lovely experience. The very best thing is the location... I don't think you can stay any closer to American Girl!! From our hotel, we walked everywhere and were near all the great shopping, sights, and restaurants. Another kid favorite practically right out the door was The Cheesecake Factory. For visiting the museums, we hopped in one of the cabs that line up near the hotel. One of the days we were there, it was pouring rain and as we left the hotel, there were buckets of umbrellas for use by the guests. The staff was helpful and friendly. We ate breakfast at the grill at the hotel and it was very good. Our room did not have a view, but the beds were comfortable and the bathroom very large and everything was very clean. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: xviniciox
Reviews.Content: It is the best location in the area of â€‹â€‹Michigan Ave, which is one of the most requested in Chicago. For those who like going out at night, is only two blocks from Rush Street, where you will find some of the best bars and lounges in Chicago and you can easily walk. Located 2 blocks from Water Tower Place, where there is an excellent place for lunch called Foodlife. You will find huge variety of cuisine at a great price. For we who are from Brazil and love juices and vitamins, there is a specific location that makes wonderful natural juices. Despite the description seem to deal with a food court, it is not! It's worth checking out. About the hotel is great. The rooms are large, the infrastructure is very good and the hotel is very clean. The only bad thing is the price of parking, but in Chicago you hardly find a cheap place to park. You will probably find cheapest hotels in Chicago arear, however if you want to stay at Michigan Avenue, the Westin is undoubtedly the best cost-benefit choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not "Heavenly" at this Westin”
Reviews.Author: spotdog
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed at this hotel for several years and what a huge disappointment on my return. The location is spot on - close to the Hancock, Water Tower Place and the Shops at 900 Michigan. Hotel is steps from Michigan with all Chicago has to offer....and that's all the pros I can say about this Westin. Despite my cheery greetings at check-in, I was met by a bit of a sour puss who gave me the usual room by the elevator but for $99 for a one night stay, that was ok. Someone else mentioned a renovation of the rooms but mine (with the exception of the carpet) was like a backwoods motel 6. Peeling paint and chipped and dated furniture. Even the heavenly bed had fallen from grace..sunken in the middle and tired, grey white bedding. Concierge was also miserable...argued with me that there was a Chicago Where mag in my room when there wasn't..I did have a ratty, stained print out of hotel services. Had to turn the pages with my nails then wash my hands. Yuk - Also, do not spend $57 to park your car. That's outrageous and at the next block (2 mins walk) on the same side of the street there is a $28 a night garage with in and out allowed. If you get this hotel for around $100 then the location is worth it, otherwise, there are far better hotels in Chicago with staff that make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm...I liked this!”
Reviews.Author: bratz84
Reviews.Content: I paid about $100 (including taxes, fees, etc.) for a standard king-size bed room via Hotwire. I was pretty happy about the price unti l read the reviews here on TripAdvisor. Of course since it was a Hotwire room the view was horrendous, however I was pleasantly surprised. The decor is a sparse-vanilla-contemporary, but it wasn't bad, just bland. I was expecting the decor to be outdated. The room was clean and comfortable, the location was fantastic! Customer service was great. When checking in/out we were guided by a handful of employees. I forgot my toothbrush and toothpaste, so I called the "service express" and had some (complimentary) brought to my room within a few minutes. We checked out 15 minutes late and that was not a problem. Oh, and the hallways seemed to be scented with some sort of spa-scent.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: 83traveler
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Westin was fine...don't understand all the negative reviews! The hotel was well kept...amenities were nice and restocked daily - (we always tip housekeeping.) Location is great so you save a lot on cab fares. All staff gave us exceptional service including: bellmen, front desk, wait staff and gift shop. We only needed to use the internet once, so I can't really comment on that. The front desk graciously let us come down to use one of their computers when we needed to print something after business center was closed. I would not say this hotel is outstanding, but it was a comfortable place to stay for a girls weekend when we were really there to see the city. Prices for drinks and food were in line with all the other places that we visited while we were here. We slept well and were treated well. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: jodamo
Reviews.Content: Not the nicest 4-star hotel, but our price was fair for the location compared to other hotels in the area. ($100 for a saturday night - can't really complain!) Service was good. Check-in process was smooth and accommodating. No real issues. We stayed on one of the "Starwood Preferred Guest" floors but couldnt figure out what was different about it besides the title. Comfortable, but not luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't bother -- Much better choices”
Reviews.Author: Kalorama46
Reviews.Content: Rennovated tower room had as much personality as a padded cell. Location is great. Fine if you get a crazy low rate or using SPG points. But, I will never stay here again. All complaints by prior guests are justified. Starwood should just pull the flag or use this hotel as a test case for a Westin brand relaunch. Westin was cutting edge 15 years ago (although this hotel certainly never could have been described as cutting edge at any time) But, it could easily become the hospitality anachonism that Sheraton has long been.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: astorix
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure which was worse -- the poor service by maids, bellmen, and doormen or the internet connection which was powered by hamsters on exercise wheels and was so slow as to be completely useless. When we arrived in the midst of a downpour (and I was in a leg cast) there was no one to help us unload the cab or to assist with the luggage. One day the maid left us no towels. Other days our room was cleaned until very late in the afternoon (even though we had been out all day). The location is wonderful, but I don't think it makes up for these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Mark4545
Reviews.Content: $269 a night, but hotel, rooms and hallways were clean. Staff seemed friendly and helpful, but didn't talk to them much. Hallways and elevators noisy due to other guests and the plain inner workings of the elevators. When elevator passed the floor, it sounded like it was going to come through the wall. Elevators were also slow, waited 20 minutes at one point for one to arrive at our floor. Water pressure in room was very poor. Took 20 minutes to fill bathtub to just above ankles. Two shower heads, exactly the same, not sure why they were both there as using just one with the poor water pressure was not enough to remove all the soap. In room internet was so slow, it seemed we were connected to old time dial up. Took over 5 minutes for a page to load, and it was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeddAnger7
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the Westin Michigan Avenue on Business and for personal reasons. Both experiences were exceptional. From a business perspective, the meeting rooms we needed were perfect and the customer service was over the top. Lara Rooney did a fantastic job at surpassing our expectations and providing great customer service. The event was a great success. The hotel room was beautiful and clean and the staff was very helpful. You can't beat the location. We look forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, extremely bad customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Tara M
Reviews.Content: The good part about staying in this hotel is that it is centrally located, right smack in the middle of all of the action! However, parking is $57 for 24 hours even when staying as a guest of the hotel, no breakfast is offered, and the staff was not helpful in any way! I stayed in this hotel for two nights for a wedding celebration. On the second day, while getting ready we blew a fuse, not once, but TWICE! Each time, it took a minimum of two phone calls (3 phone calls the second time) and about 25 minutes before it came back on, nearly making us late to the wedding reception! Next, we had to ask 3 different employees to locate a band-aide before calling the manager down. Fortunately, we got our band-aide after waiting 10 minutes for her to come downstairs to meet us. Staff is poorly trained in customer service, as well as management. For $240 per night, this was by far the worst experience I have ever had in ANY hotel, let alone a hotel on Michigan Avenue! Think twice before booking with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Average corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: sf2world
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this Westin. Rooms are pretty generic and seem about 10 years from latest refresh. Rather Marriottesque (not a compliment). Had a deluxe room on one of the top floors with good views but nothing else to get excited about. Little inexpensive things would help like an i-pod dock (room only had a basic clock radio) and some better bath amenities like mouthwash, shower gel and the like. I would expect no less for a room at this price level and as a SPG Platinum. Fitness room is on the small side but is okay. Great location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: demendieta
Reviews.Content: This is a centrally located hotel in the middle of the Magnificent Mile. Near restaurants and some of the best shopping. Hotel is spotless, and operated by capable and conscious staff. A great restaurant, The Grill< and awesome bar. A Starbucks in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average Westin, good location but rooms are tired”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many westin properties on business and this one is not as good as most. It's location is good but that's about all. The negatives include $47 valet parking per night (with no good/safe alternative option nearby), no free internet even for starwoods rewards members, staff that are bored and not helpful, uneven room temperature (musty fsmell, then too cold, then too warm, etc). The bedding is nice as expected but the bathroom and carpets could use deep cleaning and update. There are so many nicer Chicago hotels than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: BookbuyerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I had a an excellent two night stay at this hotel. The sound from the adjoining rooms could be an issue as any sound the neighbors made when arriving or leaving was clearly audible but fortunately I was lucky with the neighbors I had. The location is right next door to the Hancock building and the view I had was running straight up Michigan Avenue which was really quite pleasant to watch. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were spotlessly clean. So a thumbs up for this location.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare”
Reviews.Author: andre233
Reviews.Content: The experience here was a true nughtmare. On both nights people were moving furniture on the floor just over my room all night long On the morning after the first night I was awaken by some very very loud employees of the Hotel shoutting at each other on the hallway. On the second night some drunk guests started knocking on evey door in my floor. I called security and they said they would send someone over to check. Nobody showed up and the guests kept shoutting and knocking, drinking champagne in the hallway. A true nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities right on Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: diharris27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Hotel on Michigan Avenue during our recent visit to Chicago. It was convenient to all of the sights, and the staff were friendly and helpful to us. They have a wonderful restaurant with outdoor seating (weather permitting) and excellent food. Their spa was just what we needed after spending hours walking every day. Seeing Millennium Park is a must do. Go to the huge visitor's center to get tons of information on what to see and do. Hotel staff were great about making suggestions for dining in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrru21
Reviews.Content: Computers were down for 2 hrs so I couldn't check in right away but they did hold my bags. Room was small but the bed was comfy. Don't stay near the elevator because it was pretty noisy at all hours. They have a restaurant, bar and coffee corner which was perfect for my needs. There was an airport check in station also but it didn't work very well so I just used my Blackberry. Overall it was your basic commuter business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: rcl5
Reviews.Content: Westin Michigan Ave is a great location and good place for a family get away. We usually do weekends there just to get away and find the hotel clean, lively and convenient to almost everythign we do. Clsoe to beach in summer, Water Tower, Hancock Center, healthy walk to river and Millineum Park etc. Staff seems rushed most of the time, not as personable as some places we stay downtown but nothing rude or abrasive. We enjoy the Grill on the Alley, excellent steaks and service, most nights we have been there it has been quiet which we don't get. Food has been very good, service attentive, nice atmosphere, good wine list. The bar there is a nice place to watch some sports and gaze out at life towards Michigan ave and the Hancock. Rooms are due for a refresh, flat screens a nice addition but bathrooms need some improvement. Not bad by any stretch but for a Westin, expectations a bit higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: CCPC001NewHampshire
Reviews.Content: Had a room with a beauiful view of Lake Michigan. Was there for a business meeting and we walked to some great area restaurants and Rush st as well. It was clean, comfortable and they treated their guest in a friendly, professional manner. I'll definitely book this hotel when in Chicago next time. About $25 cab ride from Midway.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: TheAnalyst
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in August. Wi-Fi is free if you're an SPG member, which is free to join. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, but there is a Cheesecake Factory right across the street, which is a way better value anyway. The rooms are basic, but clean and the housekeepers were more than willing to accomodate special requests (I left them a $5 tip each night and that probably helped). The location is a little north on Michigan Ave for sightseeing, but ideal for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Family wedding. Everything was great. The employees were helpful and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: patricia b
Reviews.Content: I found the employees of the Westin very helpful. We arrived early for a wedding and wanted to see part of the city. They gave us helpful tips and directions to things we would want to see and how best to get around!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyemarc
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to Chicago for business or pleasure the Westin on Michigan Ave should be on the top of your list. I have stayed at alot of Westin and W properties and this is one of my favorites. You are located right on Michigan Ave and only steps away from the Hancock Building, Water Tower Place, and the Lakefront. The hotel staff is friendly and the rooms are nice, clean, and have great views of the Michigan Ave and the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience - Stranded in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 night because I was stranded in Chicago by Hurricane Irene. While waiting at the airport I used priceline to bid on a room and won this hotel. I only spent a quick night here, but everything was fine. Check in was quick and friendly, the basic king room was large which I love, bathroom was big and new. Slept like a baby and checked out promptly the next morning. Nothing bad to report, was quite pleased to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Jestrada13
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I was not looking forward to staying at the Westin after I had booked the hotel through priceline. Maybe the bar was set really low, but I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel and our room. We stayed in a room on the 11th floor and we didn't notice any outside noise from the halls or elevators. The room was basic, but clean and spacious. It's definitely an older hotel and probably could use an upgrade in decor, but again, it was clean, and the bed was comfortable. I would put it on par with the Courtyard Marriott I've stayed at in Austin, TX and Budapest, Hungary.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!”
Reviews.Author: Missb9797
Reviews.Content: Good location ...is about it! The rooms are not soundproof. We were woken up every night of our 4 night stay by drunk kids in the halls at every hour.. The concierge only works until 4 or 5 pm. Our shower nor our sink would drain properly....we were standing in a pool of water while showering.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: wjjmaj
Reviews.Content: We thought this was suppose to be an upscale hotel but it is mediocre at best. While you can give it four diamonds for what it has to offer, you must give it a three or two for service. We struggled to get our bags through the door without aid of the doorman who might have held the door open for us if he was so inclined. We attended a business conference that was hosted at this hotel. Coffee after breakfast? Really? Asked for tea but it never came. Never cleaned the tables before a class was held in the room. While our room was adequate and was comfortable, our companions had to deal with bugs. Woke up with bites on her face the second night. Management said "all hotels have to deal with bugs." Great answer. On the third night the room was infested with these flying bugs and the hotel moved our companions in the middle of the night to a "room with a view" and had the audacity to charge them more for it! View...at 12:00 midnight? As it turned out, there were dead bugs in the roller shade of the new room. In addition, the hallways are noisy and you can hear everything. Personally, I wouldn't recommend this facility for a conference nor a stay. There are better options I'm sure in Chicago. The staff is downright unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location... and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Bradley L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a late August weekend in the fabulous city of Chicago. We found the Westin Michigan Avenue to be ideally located. Not a new property by any means, nonetheless, the Westin is great! Our room 1644 was well appointed and very clean, with an upgraded bathroom and extremely comfortable bed, and a view of the John Hancock Bldg out our window, (the building being directly across the street). Lots of American Girl families seem to choose the Westin as well, with the store being only a block away. Park elsewhere, however. The Westin charges $55 a night. We found a private garage around the corner that was more reasonable at $32.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: travelrevi
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel ad what saves it is the location. An easy walk to the best areas of the city. It is safe ad the area is clean and nice. The staff is excellent. The restaurant is nice and the rooms are clean for the most part. The bathrooms are nice and clean as well. However, the rooms are loud! I travel often and this hotel has the poorest insulation both internal and external for noise. I would stay here again but request a quiet room. Otherwise wear ear plugs to sleep...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location... Worth a Shot”
Reviews.Author: shafferadamj
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Westin Michigan Avenue in mid-July during a big heat wave in Chicago. Had very good weather otherwise with no rain and with plenty to do outside in Chicago, this hotel proved to be a great starting point to explore other parts of the city. We checked in on Friday evening and stayed on the 23rd floor (I believe) in the taller tower (Eastern set of elevators). The elevators were a bit slow but it is a very large hotel so that was expected. The room was clean and comfortable although we did have an issue with the "Green" promotion going on where we chose to forego maid service in exchange for 500 Starpoints. We did this 2 of the 3 Nights (since you can't do it the night you check out) but they only left us one coupon even though they clearly didn't clean any of the nights. Bit frustrating and even after calling, the additional points never showed up! Our view of the Hancock Tower was nice and pleasant although you can hear doors slamming from other rooms. Also lots of large groups (including the Florida Marlins and dozens of foreign flight crews) were at the hotel so hopefully you don't get stuck checking-in behind these massive groups or convention-goers. A few short blocks to the "El" station was convenient but you really should try and take advantage of the bus system that runs up/down Michigan Avenue. While confusing (especially if you're not from a major city), it really gets you where you need to go quickly and efficiently. We took the bus from Wrigleyville along the river and was back to the hotel in less than 10 minutes, whereas we could have waited for the "El" for 10 minutes. Also good for rush hour as the buses run every 3-4 minutes and head to the Loop quite effortlessly. If you are there for 72-hours, definitely get the 3-day pass as it is active for 72 hours from initial activation for $14. Worth it since you can use it on the bus and "El." Overall, pleasant stay - didn't interact too much with staff as we barely spend any time in the hotel room itself.

Reviews.Title: “appreciated manager”
Reviews.Author: J F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin with another couple. The special was "stay 2 nites, get the 3rd night free" ended up costing 176.00 a night plus tax. This isn't so bad for a North Michigan Ave. hotel. Our friends were on the top floor. We were on the 18th. They managed to have no coffee 2 of the 3 days and no towels 1 of the 3 days. Was it because they were at the end of the hall and housekeeping ran out? Don't know; but it was annoying to say the least. Turns out the front desk manager, Kelly made up for it and gave us enough certificates for dinner in the restaurant. Tried to pay with those certificates and the waiter said, "Oh these are for room service" So we put them on our rooms and Kelly took them off. Turned a bad experience into a major thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever plan on going back :(”
Reviews.Author: gsmoote
Reviews.Content: Took my family along with my dad and sister's family to Chicago for the weekend and stayed at the Westin. Almost everything went wrong. Our rooms weren't available when we were told and ended up having to check our bags and come back later. Found the front desk staff very unhelpful and rude. Later my 5 year old daughter discovered broken glass all over our bathroom floor so it obviously hadn't been cleaned. When putting my kids to bed, noticed one of our bags was never brought to the room. Spoke to the front desk and was told bag was nowhere to be found. Therefore my 4 and 5 year old had to sleep in their dirty underwear and had no toiletries. Called the next morning and also stopped at the front desk to see if bag could be found. Answer was "no". Kids wore dirty clothes and upon leaving the hotel around 1:30pm the next day asked again about the bag. Was finally offered the opportunity to look in the storage closets for my bag. Walk in and what do you know.......my bag was there the whole time! Also was missing a grocery bag with snacks and drinks for my family that we brought. That was never found. Needless to say, terrible experience for my birthday and my daughters birthday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service - never again will I go back”
Reviews.Author: Dana B
Reviews.Content: Initially, we were very satisfied with this hotel upon arrival. The location was close to everything we had planned on doing and the room was clean. Our troubles began around 6pm the day of arrival (we were only staying one night). Our neighbors were a group of young 20-something kids who were running up and down the hall, slamming their door repeatedly, and yelling. After about 20 minutes of this, I went down to the front desk to ask what could be done. I was told that this hotel had a "zero tolerance policy" and they would be given one warning and then evicted. While I did not want anyone evicted, their response was satisfactory to us as we felt the situation would be handled, and we left the hotel and went out for a while. Upon our return at 10pm, our neighbors were still loud and were preventing us from falling asleep. We called the front desk, and for the second time that evening, security came up to their room to speak with them. The security officer told our neighbors that we were the ones who complained. Our neighbors got revenge on us at 2:30 in the morning, by banging on our door and yelling. We called security for the third time, and the hotel offered us a new room, but at 2:30 in the morning, who wants to switch? After a night of no sleep and feeling very dissatisfied with the way the hotel handled the situation, we spoke to the manager (Shawn/Sean) at check out. The manager could not even look us in the eye, gave a simple apology, and did not care when we said we would never stay at this hotel again. I was shocked at how much he seemed not to care about what happened, despite the hotel mission statement of leaving guests feeling "well-rested." I'm not sure where the people who work for this establishment were trained on customer service/security skills, but they failed miserably. We left feeling incredibly disappointed and angry with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RunnerJess86
Reviews.Content: This past winter was the second time my husband and I stayed at this property and loved it again. Growing up near Chicago and visiting frequently, I have stayed at MANY properties there, and this is one of my favorites. The location is great! I would definitely book a Michigan Ave. view room. I booked online through their website and got a great deal. I paid up front and got a two night stay on a weekend with a Michigan Ave. view PLUS parking for $170 total (parking is normally $50/day alone). I would highly suggest going on their website, as they usually have great online deals that you won't get through another website or by calling to book reservations. The lobby is nice and check-in was quick both times. One complaint I have is that I wish the concierge was around more/that they had more than one. We were there on a weekend and they disappeared after about 5:00 both nights. Plus, as there was only one, there is often a long line waiting to ask questions. We got just a standard room and it was nice for what we paid. The bed is comfortable, and like I said, our view of the street was great. The workout room is a tad small for the size of the building--about 5 or 6 treadmills, a couple Ellipticals and a couple bikes. While we were there, two treadmills also were not working. If it's nice outside, you can always just run outside I guess, but in Feb., that wasn't an option. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. The location is great, yet I didn't notice any street noise while we were sleeping. I have stayed at other Westin properties, too, and have been pleased every time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, we WILL be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Tina_Simon
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly staff. Would def recommend this hotel as it is perfectly located within the Downtown Chicago area. Beautiful city, with friendly people! Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not awful, but not great”
Reviews.Author: adougla2
Reviews.Content: The Westin quality seems to be on the decline. There was nothing heavenly about my bed or shower. The towel/washcloth quality and bathroom toiletries were pretty poor quality as well. I have come to expect alot from the Westin and those expectations weren't met. The bellmen were slow and not very helpful. The valet attendant took forever to get my vehicle, apparently they store the cars elsewhere, not always on hotel property. That being said the hotel was clean and did the trick, so I can't say I'd never ever return. Room service menu prices didn't match what I was charged...I was overcharged, not acceptable!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our first visit to Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTravelhappy
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this well located hotel. It is on Michigan Avenue so we were steps from shopping and dining options. The nearest cta train station was six blocks away, an easy walking distance, which allowed us to explore many of the interesting neighborhoods in Chicago (A visit to Wicker Park-Bucktown is a must if you like art, eclectic shops and independent boutiques.) Also there is easy access to buses/taxis that run outside the hotel so no need to rent a car! Our hotel room was very comfortable and well appointed. The Westin is known for their heavenly beds and we definitely slept well. The bathroom was a great size and had a huge vanity which was really nice. It did not have an exhaust fan which I thought was unusual but I think this has to do with the age of the hotel as it is an older property. The highlight of the hotel was the smiling staff and the service we received. Everyone we interacted with was super nice and very helpful. We arrived in the morning and although our room was not ready yet, the front desk was able to check us in and allow us to store our bags, so we were free to explore the city before returning later to pick up our hotel keys. Housekeeping forgot to leave cups in our room one day and this was promptly rectified once we called. Later I even received an apology via email from the Rooms Supervisor - nice touch and total surprise! The hotel was able to accomodate a later checkout by two hours which allowed us to get in some last minute shopping before having to leave for the airport to catch our flight home. Overall we very much enjoyed our stay and would definitely seek out the Westin Michigan Ave again.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago is a great city!”
Reviews.Author: l0la16
Reviews.Content: Great location! Friendly staff! Would stay here again! Parking a little expensive: valet 55$ for 24hrs. While walking around later in the evening,we found a sign that said valet parking 24hrs for 33$. Would highly recommend staying here during your stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls!”
Reviews.Author: vegasbride07
Reviews.Content: We generally prefer Westin because of great service and the Heavenly Bed, and always try to choose SPG brands, as their awards are amazing. My husband was at the Westin on Michigan avenue 2 weeks ago, however, and had one major complaint. They put him in a room next door to a family with a small child, and all night he could here every word they said, as well as the child crying! Wouldn't you think, at check in, they would see a business man travelling on his own and not put him next to a family with a small child? Of course, if the walls weren't so thin it might have not mattered. My husband did complain to the front desk, and they assured him the people next door to him were checking out, so it turned out alright by the time I joined him for the weekend. He was just disappointed to have his first ever poor night's sleep in a Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: VaDee
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, staff is very helpful and it is in a great location. It is right on Michigan Ave in the Gold Coast area. It is 2 blocks from the beach and right across the street from the water tower and Macy's.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and it is an overall great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DallasGirl85
Reviews.Content: I was the guest of my best friend for a trip to Chicago. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and nice. The concierge assisted us several times, and always followed up to make sure we were satisfied. The location was perfect. We walked everywhere, and loved being right on Michigan Avenue. I was a little disappointed when we returned from a concert and Room Service was no longer serving. Luckily, we had bought extra popcorn at Garrett's that day and just enjoyed more popcorn. I also had an issue with water coming in from the window, but it was minor. Bathroom plumbing could be improved. The lobby is spacious and has nice little seating areas if you are connecting with someone in the lobby. Also, it had the perfect little giftshop to grab trinkets, postcards, stamps, etc. I needed the business center while I was there. There was always an available computer with printer. (It was a FedEx business center.) I can overlook the minor issues and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location....”
Reviews.Author: JHAFlorida
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several different hotels in Chicago. This was the best location so far. The rooms were clean and comfortable, I really enjoyed the clean and spacious bathrooms. The staff at this hotel were very helpful, especially the doormen. I agree with the other reviewers that at least a bottle of water should be provided and the WiFi should be free for all guest. Stll, I highly recommend this hotel because of its excellent location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “location, location”
Reviews.Author: rusty0707
Reviews.Content: for the price and location this was a very good hotel. We got a hotel on the north side, but south side views of the hancock are much better. overall had a great stay, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Todders728
Reviews.Content: We live in the suburbs and stay downtown occasionally (after a cubs game, for a night out at the blues clubs). The only complaints I would have is the lack of a bottle of water in the room. Every hotel needs to have at least one bottle of water in the room, even if they charge for it. Second thing would be the valet. Our car was almost taken by another family because the valet was not checking the tickets. Other than that, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Jeeves1204
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were bridesmaids in a wedding over the July 16th weekend, and we booked reservations here for our stay. The location is great as it is close to everything on Michigan Ave. The hotel was clean, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. They day after the wedding, I accidentally left my bouquet in the hotel lobby. I felt awful that I had left it there as my friend's wedding was very important to me. I called the hotel to see if they could mail the bouquet to me. The staff was so nice and helpful with crazy request. They boxed up the bouquet and shipped it right out to me.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location but....”
Reviews.Author: ckinct
Reviews.Content: No question about it! The location is fabulous! The rooms were clean. Beds were comfortable. Wi-Fi was fine once I was assured I wasn't paying for it since I am a Starwood member. There were some misses though. Apparently there is a program that id you want to be "green", you can do so. (found in other hotels too. less towel washing, etc) And supposedly you earn a free drink in bar by doing it...perhaps other perks. I can not really tell you since it was never mentioned at check in OR on display in room. I am a Starwood member and was told by other Starwood members there would be perks but never saw them. We were part of large conference. A $100 hold was put on our credit cards for the week. Some people had cards that didn't have that amount on them and it proved embarrassing. It also may have prevented some form doing some serious shopping. This final comment has nothing to do with the hotel. GO Shuttle service failed miserably to accommodate the many in our group with reservations. Thankfully, the doorman at Westin suggested we take a cab rather than wait and use the next shuttle. I think he had seen it before. Partly, our conference might have been to blame by suggesting them AND NOT making sure company could handle the volume.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cmsgreek
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. Service is pretty good, and overall very clean. Many conveniences located in the lobby, and extensive business and conference facilities. The rooms have amazing views, and are fairly nice with a standard size. Bedding is decent, even though it should be better for the price. As far as for location, you cannot possibly find a better hotel. It is located in the heart of Michigan Avenue, right across the street from the John Hancock Center and the Water Tower. Malls, restaurants, and more are in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Poor Internet”
Reviews.Author: Consultbishop
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, heat for shopping and enjoying a run down Lake Shore Drive. WiFi connection is really weak, room service is ridiculously expensive and rooms are only so so good. Staff answer your questions, but less than friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: weekendgetaways010
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this Westin location. Wonderful location, just blocks from Oak Street Beach and steps from shopping on Michigan Avenue. Staff at check-in was wonderful. We even used the new spa for massages, it was wonderful. Will stay here again. Restaurant was the best!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints! I was satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: spinkid
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one week for a convention and was quite pleased. The location is wonderful, it is across the street from Water Tower Place as well as the rest of the great shopping on Michigan Avenue. It is just a few blocks from the beach.
