It is also next to the Hancock Building. It is a few blocks from the Red Line to get you elsewhere in the city. Taxis are also plentiful in this area. The room was comfy, cool, and clean. Check-In was easy as well. I really didn't need to interact with the staff, since everything was pretty seamless.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for the price.”
Reviews.Author: LarryLV
Reviews.Content: For the price ($300/night) service from check-in to check-out should have been over the top and it wasn't. The room was nice, but maid service was lacking attention. There was a vase of dead flowers on the concierge desk that never got refreshed. Next time I'll try The Drake or The Palmer House.

Reviews.Title: “Free Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: fricknfrack85
Reviews.Content: My cousins and I went to Chicago for a fun one-night stay. I was worried about our room as we were going to be sharing a 2 double bed room for 6 people and I had booked it through a third party sight. This typically means that we would get the smallest room in the place. I was absolutely shocked when we were given a free suite upgrade and a corner room looking right down to Michigan Avenue. The staff was really friendly (especially when I had to get my key replaced at 4 AM), the room was clean and quiet. I know my stay isn't typical, but I did want to voice my pleasure with this stay! The cost of parking is really my only complaint ($55/night!).

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: jgnGreenbay
Reviews.Content: We went to celebrate our 26th Wedding Anniversary, both of our Birthdays and Fathers Day The Staff was wonderful - they upgraded our room, and sent us 6 Chocolate covered Strawberries and a bottle of wine (also two diet soda's) They also sent us two cards signed by the staff wishing us a Happy Anniversary The rooms were clean and the view of the lake and beach was awesome Very quiet and the employee's were very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Best Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Begm87
Reviews.Content: In the month of June it is my parents anniversay, both of their birthdays and fathers day. Needles the say June is a very busy month for me. Kira Leigh and Rhonda Chan went above and beyond to make sure that my parents had the time of their lifes. Kira and i have been emailing back and forth and she helped me set up amenities for my parents and as soon as I was able to get on property, Rhonda got my parents some city passes to see the sites. Thank you to both of you AND the Westin for having such an outstanding staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: DCWP
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in this Westin. Usually I rave about the brand, but this property is tired and in need of freshening, at least as far as the rooms are concerned. No Heavenly Shower, for one thing. The hotel had almost no hot water at 6:45 am on a Tuesday. I told the front desk, and, to their credit, the problem was resolved by Wed. morning, if not sooner. The sink in my bathroom would not drain properly. Maintenance came and fixed it during the day on Tuesday, so, again, not a big deal, but still somewhat surprising. The lighting in the bathroom left a lot to be desired. It felt a bit cave-like. The view was a plus - lakeview, with a decent look to the north and Lake Michigan and the beach area. I didn't try any of the on-site dining, so I can't comment on that. Getting my car from the hotel parking lot took between 20 and 30 minutes on Wed. evening. Definitely annoying. I don't know if the hotel owns the lot, or what their relationship is with the lot, but that should be addressed, particularly at $55/day for parking. Overall, this was an average stay. The hotel was so-so, but the location was good, so getting to meetings at the Peninsula, Ritz, and other properties was pretty easy. The Michigan Ave. location was also nice, especially with the great weather during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Minor downfalls”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTNBeachBum
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin this past weekend for a friends weekend. Our service was really good and we never had any trouble with getting help with our bags or getting help with a taxi. There was always someone there to help us with both, very quickly as well. The rooms were a little outdated, but not a big deal to us. My only complaint is that the maid took our dirty towels and wash clothes, but didn't replenish us with new ones. I don't know how this happens at a major hotel chain? The location is the best feature. It is within walking distance to almost everything. When I return to Chicago, I will probably not want to spend $274 (tax included)/night again, but if you have the money, I would recommend it. However, I think I can get a cheaper rate from another hotel chain a block away (Holiday Inn Express, Red Roof Inn--both of which looked really nice from the street).

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not as good as in the past”
Reviews.Author: snj1027
Reviews.Content: Overall, the location is great and the rooms are decent. I had made some plans for my wifes birthday prior to the trip and the hotel did not execute. They were apologetic and tried to make up, but that attempt didn't happen either. Spoke to mgt and they apologized and gave me some points which was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: ErikaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Nice location, nice staff, clean room with updates. Conference rooms are clean, carpet could stand to be updated. Fair warning - the elevators at this hotel are very very slow!

Reviews.Title: “Great location poor service”
Reviews.Author: Checkedout77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in May 2011. Our impression from the taxi was great but on arrival things went downhill. The doorman on arrival had no interest in assisting us despite having heavy luggage. We lugged our bags into the lobby past numerous bellman who also had no interest in providing service. Checking was quick an efficient and we liked our room located on the 15th floor. The bed was nice and the shower was good. On departure we called for luggage assistance but no luck. We lugged our luggage to the lobby to checkout which was quick and efficient. While my wife was checking out I attempted to get the bellman who was standing close by to assist us in getting a taxi. No luck again. We lugged our bags outside. I complained to the doorman about the lack of service, the doorman laughed and said to me that the bellman who watched us carry our luggage and hail our taxi and open our own doors didn't do bags. Overall we liked the hotel but we didn't like the attitude. Other Westin Hotels have been excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Living on past glories”
Reviews.Author: mjtoal
Reviews.Content: I am currently at the Westin, in town for a large medical convention, so perhaps it is not a fair time to review the hotel when it is completely full with people all working to similar schedules. So take that issue into account if you wish. Even so, I have stayed at many hotels during similar conventions, and at many Westins (used to be SPG Platinum). I got an upgrade to a Lake View room. Lake view is technically correct because I can see some lake, but can only see it either side of a large high rise building smack in the middle of the eyeline. OK, it ain't Westin's fault that the building is there, but perhaps partial lake view would be more accurate. The room is otherwise OK, decent bed and flat screen TV, decent bathroom, but otherwise unremarkable and if I was dropped here and told I was in a Marriott at $120 a night, I wouldn't know different. Breakfast is served in the restaurant on the lobby level, and being convention time, it is pretty busy. The buffet is decent enough, fairly average by US hotel standards. Probably a bit overpriced at $25 plus the pre-filled gratuity. The Westin Workout gym was a major disappointment.It features prominently on the hotel website, but is really just a room with some cycles, treadmills and cross trainers, and a few pieces of resistance equipment and free weights. Several of the cardio pieces were out of order, so there were 3 treadmills and no upright cycles in use, and since people usually occupy the treadmills for 20 or 30 minutes at a time, this morning I gave up and left after waiting for a while. That is pretty annoying. The gym needs to be upgraded in quality and size or de-emphasised on the website. Several colleagues are staying at Trump right now and suggested I joined them, but I said I would be happy enough at the Westin. Overall, this Westin seems pretty average. I doubt that is what they aspire to, but I don't think they can claim any more. Oops.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Worst, but wouldn't come back”
Reviews.Author: BBuddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin on N. Michigan Avenue during Memorial Day Weekend. First off, we landed in Oâ€™Hare and took the subway to the hotel. After switching trains in downtown Chicago and walking 6 blocks we finally arrived at the hotel. There are only two things going for the Westin on Michigan Ave, itâ€™s location to shopping and the Westin Heavenly Bed. One of which you could get at another Westin or Starwoods property and the other via taxi. Check in was quick and since I am a â€œpreferred Starwoods Memberâ€� I was told I was upgraded to a higher floor reserved for â€œpreferred membersâ€�. The room did not appear to be â€œpreferredâ€�. It was directly behind the service elevators and I could hear the elevators operating all day and night. Luckily I brought ear plugs to wear while sleeping otherwise I would have gotten no sleep. Additionally, the rooms themselves are not quiet. You could hear anyone and everyone in the hallways (and there were lots of unruly screaming children running down the halls too). The room itself was on the smaller side, a king size bed, two night stands, a bureau with TV on top, desk and soft chair with ottoman. My one complaint about the furniture, which I donâ€™t usually comment on, was that there were not drawers on the nightstands only doors that opened to the space below. Additionally, there were no drawers in the desk either. The only drawers in the room were the 4 small drawers in the bureau under the TV. The other part of the bureau housed the refrigerator with stocked overpriced items. The bathroom was standard for a hotel room and appeared clean although the housekeeping staff never gave us an extra towel or soap or shampoo. Being a preferred member I also got free Wi-fi access, however, the wi-fi here was pathetic. I had faster service on my 3G phone than the wifi, it was a worthless benefit. A big beef I have with hotels is that the beds are not completely made. After sleeping in the bed once I once again found that the sheets did not reach the bottom of the bed and the mattress and the small mattress pad were exposed. I had to pull off all the sheets and covers so that the staff would correct it. Additionally, the Westin usually gives you extra pillows in the room, this Westin did not, however, housekeeping did provide us with a few extra pillows. Westin offers a workout facility in each of their hotels. Iâ€™ve been to some really nice hotel facilities and some not-so nice ones, this hotel ranks in the middle. They did provide dumbbells but had no cable machine and 4 plate type machines. There were also a couple of aerobic machines (treadmill/ellipticals) but not many. Our room did not have a view either. We overlooked another building across the way. As I stated in the beginning, the Westin Heavenly bed was the only plus to our visit. Would be stay here again? No, while we like Starwood properties, we would try another first. When you pay more money for a Starwood property, you expect higher service and quality. This property did not deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Westin we have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: RoyalCafe
Reviews.Content: I normally try & exclusively stay at Westin hotels such as Westin Canal Place New Orleans, Westin Savannah, Hilton Head, etc.. but this was not Westin quality. 1st I was told is was getting an upgrade because of my preferred guest status. What that did was put me on 25th floor with view of offices in Hancock Bldg and in room closest to the elevator. Tried to call for towels and no answer No heavenly double shower head, rough towels and no heavenly bed. The worst was the elevator wait up and down. We would catch it up just to keep from waiting 20 + minutes and ride it down. The cleaning lady on the 25th floor was very nice as were the bartenders in the Grille on the Alley and the blond lady concierge. Perfect location for Michigan Ave. shopping but needs upgrades to Westin standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FavorChicago
Reviews.Content: I am SPG member and absolutely love the Westin Hotel chain. I actually stayed at this property several years and was very satisfied. Therefore, we booked this property again for our weekend girlsâ€™ getaway. The location of the property is excellent however, the rooms and the workout facility were just average. The staff was very courteous and helpful. I would recommend this hotel however, I will definitely explore other properties in the same price point on Michigan Avenue for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!!!”
Reviews.Author: renelaw
Reviews.Content: Stay elsewhere. Booked a room for a long weekend. The location is GREAT. That's where it ends. Toilet? Won't flush. Windows? Leaked on our clothes (used the window sill to hold the clothes due to the lack of a luggage stand). Humid. No new shampoo/soap. Billed for the American Girl special/got none of the extras. No new wash cloths, linens, etc. Don't mind the linens (go green), but at least they could attempt to make the bed other than make the comforter look pretty despite the nightmare inside! Pillows weren't double encased, so you could see (and sometimes feel, ick!) the yellowing pillow many have used before you. Staff felt nonexistent. Wireless internet didn't work. Room was small and plain. $55/nt. to valet. Did I mention we were on a preferred floor? Geesh....

Reviews.Title: “Recommended with Reservations”
Reviews.Author: CentralABFamily
Reviews.Content: The good - Excellent location with tons of nearby options for shopping, dining, transport and sightseeing. The doormen, concierge and front desk staff were very friendly and very helpful. Meeting rooms were comfortable and the coffee service was great. We got a good rate (for this part of Chicago) through the conference room block. The not so good - I really did not sleep well in this hotel. The rooms were incredibly dry and the beds were less than heavenly. Aside from the desk chair, there was nowhere else to sit in our room. The wireless internet was the worst I have ever experienced in a hotel and it really frustrated me to have to pay for poor service. When I called about the poor service, I was directed to a call center in another time zone and received no real help. I finally plugged in and got charged twice. How can a Motel 6 pull off reliable free WiFi but a major business hotel like this Westin cannot?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Inder22
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Chicago Il for a conference. I elected to stay at the Westin Michigan Ave because I am a SPG member and decided to continue to accumulate points. The location of the hotel is fantastic! It is located directly accross the street from the john Hancock building and walking distance to great shopping and dining. The hotel rooms were very average. The rooms felt old but recently updated. The rooms were small and my room had an interior alley view, not very nice at all. The bathroom was a bit small but clean. The room was quiet and the heavenly bed did not disappoint. Overall the location makes this hotel fantastic but it does not match up to the quality that is seen in newer Westins. I think next time ill try the W hotel with my points.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is resting on its laurels -- and its location”
Reviews.Author: StacyMT
Reviews.Content: The location of the Westin Michigan Avenue is sublime, really a perfect base of operations for a weekend in Chicago. Unfortunately, the interior is not. Traveling for the first time with our 16 month old son, we booked a suite for 4 nights using points, at 20,000 points a night. This is a LOT of points, to be clear. We expected something commensurate with that price point. Unfortunately, our room (rooms 1636 and 1638) was in disrepair. We weren't able to check in at 4pm, the room still wasn't ready. When it was "ready," we found that whomever booked it before us had used it for some sort of party. The walls still had tape all over them from decorations, and sequins and sparkles were everywhere. These were the most shiny parts of the room. The furnishings and fixtures were old and cracked and chipped. The couch and pillows and curtains were stained and frayed. The wallpaper is ripped and worn. The bathrooms have no windows and no fan, so they are decidedly dank and the wallpaper is peeling. The "suite" was two regular hotel rooms with a connecting metal fire door-- the bed had been moved out of one room (which had a Murphy bed - cracked down the middle of the wood paneling -- also built into the wall), and a couch and an extra chair replaced it. In the past I traveled weekly for work and I used to be Platinum level with SPG, which is why we had the points to use at the hotel. I'm very familiar with the Westin hotels and their suites. This is not the quality I have seen previously and not what I was expecting, which was an actual suite, not two guest rooms with a connecting door passed off as for the price of a suite. Also, with a small child I had asked for a quiet room away from noise so that he wouldn't be bothered by noise and any noise from him would not bother other guests as much, and had explained my reasons for the request. They gave us rooms at the end of the hall, directly in front of the elevator. It's true that we'd be less likely to bother OTHER guests there, but apparently our own comfort was less of a concern. We also had lovely views of the offices in the Hancock building, which our room directly faced. We could not have gotten a less well-appointed suite if we had asked them to try. I may be more disappointed than I otherwise would be because over the years I was a frequent guest of the hotel for business and I remember it fondly as having lovely rooms that matched the high-end location. But I'm now realizing that those stays were several years ago, and the hotel has not been updated during that time. Things are just getting run down. The bright point of the hotel, other than the location, is the staff, most of whom were friendly and lovely and helpful with our young child. The hotel staff also did a great job of accomodating our requests for a crib and a small fridge for my son's milk and baby food. I've given this hotel 3 stars instead of 2 because of the location. But there are literally dozens of hotels within a few blocks in the same price bracket, hotels which are much more impressive than the Westin. This location used to be SPG's nicest property in Chicago. I truly hope this is no longer the case.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Max-Max-44
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean, the location perfect and the staff was friendly. Satisfactory hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...two strikes you're out!!!”
Reviews.Author: bruceygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Easter weekend with two other couples. When booking I had hesitations as my first stay there was terrible. The location was great though and the price was enticing. Never Again! So many things I can mention but will point out room was not ready on time again, my room smelled like smoke AGAIN, service at the front desk was slow and not friendly. They could not guide me to the closest catholic church, could not break a $100.00 bill and check out was a disaster. Kira in concierge was great. Darryl in front desk management was great too but neither good enough for me to recommend or stay here again. Many more hotels I discovered in the same 2-3 block radius that had same prices and great location as well. Pillows were also terrible and after travelling to many Starwood Properties for work let me say this... these beds were not HEAVENLY at all. Now I need to contact Accounting to straighten out my billing disaster! Would not recommend to anyone!!!! Shop around and definately read reviews for this hotel before booking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff. Helpful & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Salaman
Reviews.Content: Located across the street from the John Hancock Tower. We had a nice close-up view of the place from our room, #1520. I like getting around on public transit, and Michigan Ave and Chicago Ave are just steps away for all connections anywhere you wish to go in this fabulous city. We took the train( subway) in from O'hare, buying a multi-day pass at the airport. Eat at Foodlife in Water Tower Place, at least try breakfast first. You'll come back for more eats during your stay. Note : extremely popular at dinner..get there early... just a block away from the hotel . Visit the free zoo at Lincoln Park. The # 151 bus drops you off at the door. Sandy beach downtown on the Lake. Navy Pier..have a draft or two at Harry Carry's. This is a great hotel in a fantastic city which will add to your enjoyment of Chicago. Helpful staff who appear to actually be enjoying their jobs !..and they all seem to always be in such a good mood.

Reviews.Title: “I had a pleasant stay at the Westin.”
Reviews.Author: jc011202
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin and attended a conference at the hotel, and it was a very pleasant stay. Check-in was quick and easy. The staff was very kind. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The only thing was the room didn't have any toiletries upon arrival and none were put in the entire stay. I'm sure if I would have called and asked for some they would have brought them to me. The food service staff did an excellent job of feeding us breakfast and lunch at the conference. The location of the hotel is perfect. It is right in the middle of fabulous shopping and excellent dining. Overall, the experience at this Westin was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: EdenPraireMom
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite hotels in downtown Chicago. I have been here several times. My daughter goes to Loyola University Chicago and lives in the downtown campus. I came to Chicago to help move her out of her dorm. I got a good price online. Parking was expensive at 55.00 a day, but I had to do it. The room was comfortable and clean. The bed was very nice. We were looking for reservations at restaurants not frequented by tourists and Kira Leigh helped us with two great options. We had a great last weekend in Chicago and I will always look to the Westin on Michigan Avenue for a place to stay when I go back

Reviews.Title: “Typical Westin Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aimee729
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Thursday, stayed through Sunday. Yes- the hotel was more crowded on the weekend, garage parking was expensive, you have to pay for internet (I recommend bringing your own wireless card for ALL traveling)- but you are on Michigan Ave, in downtown Chicago. One would expect these things for the location and grade of hotel. We found the hotel to be clean, in good repair, comfortable, safe- however we only slept there. There are other hotel choices- above and below the "Westin experience". Choose what fits you best. We find most Westin hotels to be clean, modern, updated and in locations that put us right in the center of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit worn around the edges...”
Reviews.Author: MikefromSeattle
Reviews.Content: Not a particularly new hotel so it could use a makeover. Good location on N Michigan Ave in downtown Chicago next to the John Hancock Center. EZ walk to shopping and restaurants. Good meeting rooms for business purposes. Wireless costs $12.95/day. Health club facilities looked cramped but I did not have time to use them.

Reviews.Title: “SKETCHY”
Reviews.Author: Jenniye5
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at The Westin this past weekend for a girls getaway! We live in Chicago, however though it would be fun to get a room for the evening. 2 Things I found extremely disturbing - 1) We left the hotel room for majority of Saturday until very late Saturday evening. When we were leaving our room, we made sure to lock our door. My friend and I specifically stood by the door to make sure that the door was closed and locked. When we returned that evening, the door was propped open and the only thing that was keeping it closed was bolt in the room. My friend kicked the door in just to make sure no one was in there. Thankfully we had our valuables in the safe. 2) We checked out the next day, and unfortunately one of us forgot a garment bag with some clothes in it. It was left on the bed. The destination from the hotel was back to our apartments in Chicago, no stops in between. Therefore when we called the hotel back, knowing for a fact that the garment bag had been left in the hotel room, Lost and Found stated that nothing had been found, there was nothing left in the room. Apparantly they spoke to housekeeping and whomever cleaned our room, stated that they didn't see anything either. BEWARE, everyone found this very questionable as to why the door would be propped open Saturday evening when returning to our rooms, and then of course the missing garment bag. Unfortunate that the garment bag was misplaced and forgotten, but housekeeping should be truthful and not lie. We even tipped them when we checked out!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location - Beware the fees!”
Reviews.Author: apocalypse10k
Reviews.Content: The Westin Hotel on Michigan Ave is an excellent hotel that embodies the qualities of its brand. The location is ideal, being across the street from the Hancock Building and only a block from the Water Tower. The staff is professional and eager to help and the rooms are clean, modern and comfortable. If you stay on the South side, you have an excellent view of Michigan ave and the Water Tower! This hotel is perfect for travelers of all sorts, whether business or casual. The only things to be weary of are the fees: parking is charges at $55 a day, so find a garage nearby and save some cash. Also, in an age when every hotel has free internet, the Westin charges $12 a day for internet access! I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to spend a few days enjoying the city and wants to be in the center of it all...

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ATLtoDC
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay for our weekend in Chicago, as it was centrally located to all the local attractions. The staff was very friendly and the room was extremley spacious (upgraded to a jr suite) -- especially for the city. I stayed at the Park Hyatt a few months ago and would put this right on par with it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the heavenly beds”
Reviews.Author: superstarsrule
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel it was in a great location, good service, clean rooms. The restuarant was fantastic and we loved the heavenly bed, it was hard to get out of it in the morning! Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from Westin Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Hurley2011
Reviews.Content: The day after our arrival I had requested the room be looked over again by housekeeping because there were long black hairs in the shower, and a pacifier under the corner of the bed. The front desk worker refunded my movie ordered the night prior, and promised it would be taken care of. I was completely satisfied at that point, mistakes happen. Again I return to my room hours later, and housekeeping had been there, but the hairs remained and so did the pacifier. Upon contacting the late night manager, she informed me that housekeeping was unavailable (which is understandable) but asked if it was any of my friends hair. Who are my friends she is referring to? I was offended, it was only my boyfriend and I staying there. She offered to refund some of my points for the stay, I suggested one night (out of three) would be fine. She said no, she could only refund some of the points for one night, and then I asked why? She then replied very rudely, fine if that is what you want. I did not have the intention of getting anything for free upon the complaint. I just expected a clean room, as the Westin always provides. I am extremely disappointed in how this was handled. I can't end this review without mentioning haow friendly the front desk employee was who checked me in on Thursday evening. I wish I would have asked his name, but I am sure the manager will figure it out. He was great, and provided excellent customer service!

Reviews.Title: “expected more”
Reviews.Author: Remfbo
Reviews.Content: OK, but was expecting more. Great location, service was accepable but at the price expected more

Reviews.Title: “Overall a terrific experience”
Reviews.Author: zvilleoms
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one that we have stayed at on many occassions, and the fact that we return to the Westin Michigan Avenue at least once each year says it all. It is in a great location, close to great restaurants, shopping, and The Hancock tower/observatory. Navy Pier is only a short cab ride away as well. This particular trip we had our concierge, Kira, help us with reservations at a new restaurant. They told us there were no reservations and she was able to work them to get our party of four in anyway! She was a great help, and we look forward to our next visit to Chicago in mid-March for business!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: ekowalczyk
Reviews.Content: The staff was very warm and inviting, as was the lobby. The guestroom was nice, had a great view of the lake. The bathroom was a great size. Everytime my wife and I stay downtown we stay with the Westin Michigan Avenue. It has the best location in the city with shopping, dining and the lake within walking distance. And the best staff in Chicago! I want to thank the staff for a great weekend away from everything!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: verdegallardo
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here as an SPG Plat and was upgraded to a suite on the 15th floor. Was nice and spacious, with 2 full baths. The view was excellent, staff was excellent and the location is perfect! I have no complaints whatsoever, except for one, which comes with the territory of staying on Michigan Ave, and that was the $55 charge for parking a car overnight. All in all though, highly recommended and I'll be staying here again. Most favorite aspect would probably be the lack of pretentiousness that often comes with other hotels in the area. For dinner, you can walk across the street to the Cheesecake factory, and for lunch or breakfast, stop by L'APPETITO, a great little deli/bakery.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Hazineh
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't think of a better place to stay at. Everything is within walking distance, food, shopping, you got it all. Great value for money, and very lovely staff. Heavenly showers in bathroom not so heavenly, but otherwise , a fantastic property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for those headed Downtown”
Reviews.Author: cb8282
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin for the Chicago Marathon. The hotel was full of runners and their families but remained quiet so we were well rested. It provided us with a convenient location to sightsee around town. While we did not take advantage of it, the Hancock Tower is next door. The hotel is a short walk to stores, restaurants, and pretty much anything. I will certainly stay there the next time we are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Kira Matkaitis, Concierge, is Absolutely THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: gloriabaldino
Reviews.Content: The Westin hotels (Starwood) are always wonderful and a sure bet in any city. The service, the beds, the comfort and cleanliness is unsurpassed. But there is one concierge that stands out, and that is Kira Matkaitis at the Westin Michigan Avenue in Chicago. Late at night, in a last minute desperate need to arrange complex transportation for multiple people, and to find a way to get me multiple color copies of a lengthy and important presentation, at the last minute. She delivered, quickly, professionally, with kindness, understanding and humor. She truly went beyond the extra mile to help me out of a serious bind. I will make a point to come back here especially because of her!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Year's Eve stay! Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: MakeItRight4Traveler
Reviews.Content: My family and I are avid domestic and international travelers and Starwood preferred guests. For New Yearâ€™s Eve my husband and I gifted my parents a stay at the Westin Michigan Avenue hotel in Chicago. Itâ€™s a great location, right on Michigan Avenue, with a contemporary, open feel, in good condition, with wonderful staff and a fantastic and lively restaurant, The Grill on the Alley! Naturally, December 31st is a busy downtown hotel night with many rooms occupied for the special occasion. A couple of days prior to my parentsâ€™ arrival, I got an email from Ms. Samukeliso Dema Dema, a front desk agent, introducing herself and offering to help with any special arrangements to ensure a pleasant stay. Iâ€™ve taken the opportunity to connect with Ms. Samukeliso and expressed that we would appreciate she would be able to arrange for a complementary upgrade or a late check-out. Ms. Samukeliso was very professional, extremely responsive and wonderful to work with. Not only did she upgrade my parents to a higher floor Deluxe room, but also provided a late check-out. This made the overall Westin experience so much more special, my parents felt well taken care of and I would like to take this opportunity and recognize Ms. Samukeliso again for her contributions in creating an excellent Westin experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely does not live up to the "Westin" Brand ... Beware!”
Reviews.Author: DadERoss
Reviews.Content: First, let me say I am a SPG Member with status and I stay at Westin properties across the country frequently. This hotel falls short in every measurable catagory. I read the other reviews and thought to myself.. ahhh they must have been mistaken...well I was wrong not the other reviewers. I contacted the Platinum Concierge team to schedule my arrival, I requested 2 rooms (adjoining) and on the Preferred Guest or club level. Well we arrived precisely at 3pm for check-in, there was a massive line which i couldnt understand at first,, but as I approached the front desk I was "greeted'" by a young lady named "Sammy" who had the worst attitude as she said "welcome to Westin, how can I serve you," I smiled, provided her with the details and requested confirmation on my original requests. I was quickly told we'll we are sold out so I don't think we can accommodate those requests. I was confident the hotel was not filled at 3pm so I asked her to re-evaluate the room availability, miraculously she found 2 rooms as requested except she said there was not preffered gust floor or lounge... off to the elevators I went with my family to find 4 floor dedicated to SPG Preferred Guests... I returned to the desk where I spent the next 30 minutes trying to obtain the rooms I requested to no avail. I was told we were upgraded to 'lake view' rooms because of my status only to arrive in a room that was facing the back of the Drake Hotel and I could barely make out a sliver of the lake from our window. But hey it's New Years Eve and I wasnt going to ruin a good trip.... well the hotel and its staff did it for me ... the bed linen in the room smiled like gym socks... the bed had a huge dip in the middle...and the room wouldnt maintain its temperature. The next morning I called down to request additional towels and was once again "greeted" by Sammy....as I requested additional bathroom linens .. I tried to verify she was going to send someone to the room ... and there was no response on the line... I immediately dialed back and she answered again ... I asked if she received my request to which she replied ' I said yes, when we were on the phone before Mr. Last Name" , I attempted to say I didnt hear you confirm and once again.. she had disconnected the line. Upon checking out I decided to change my Credit Card and was told I would have to contact the accounting office on Monday to do so. I decided I had enough and immediately packed up and departed. This property should not bear the Westin name, in any way shape and form! If this is what the brand has become I will donate my points and status and move to another brand that embraces true customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: DRNS-London
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a high value stay in a perfectly central location within Chicago - right in the middle of the Michigan Avenue shopping distruct - this hotel would be tough to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average property. Poor service. Good overall value.”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Gaijin
Reviews.Content: The Westin Michigan Avenue is in a fantastic location right in the middle of North Michigan avenue. Room rates are very reasonable and the property is comfortable. It is a good option for a no frills business trip. I've stayed at the property before and I knew what to expect. It feels a bit more like a "stereotypical" US Sheraton than it does the slightly more premium Westin brand. The heavenly beds are great. The lobby feels like a Westin (i.e., slightly more stylish) but the other public spaces and the bathrooms feel a bit dated / institutional -- i..e, plastic toilet seats, old tubs, drab hallways. The surprise for me this time around was the extent to which service levels have declined. I accidentally left my toothbrush at home so asked for one after checking in. It took two calls and nearly 40 minutes for me to get one. Other service issues I noticed: - slow check out. Only one person working the front desk during the morning rush - room not cleaned until late afternoon - strange policy requiring a room deposit at time of check-in. Based on the sign at the front desk, this deposit isn't refunded until weeks after your stay My guess is that the property is struggling a bit and that they've had to make cut backs and implement the deposit policy to reduce their financial risk. I think the property is good value but would have a hard time saying it is above average. That said, given the location and the price point, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Glen040
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Westin in San Antonio, and absolutely loving everything about it, I thought the one in Chicago would be just as nice. When I made the reservation, I decided to upgrade to the "renovated" room with a view of the lake. I also was so impressed with the bed in San An, I was anxious for my husband to experience it too. I thought it would be a nice surprise to have a pretty view instead of the usual view of the side of another building. When we got there, the service at the front desk seemed to be average at best, just doing her job, nothing more, nothing less. Then we got to the room which was on the 18th floor. We could see the lake, but not nearly as nice as I assumed. A rather obstructed view. Definately not worth spending extra money. The room was ok. Seemed a bit rundown and small. Bed was very comfortable. After a late night out, it was annnoying to hear the lady in the room above us walking around in heels at seven in the morning, but what can you do about that? The lobby was pretty and nice, but the elevators seemed rundown and dirty. Overall, would rather spend my money on a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “home from home in chicago”
Reviews.Author: Irish-Frequent-Flyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel never dissapoints.It is our home from home in Chicago.The same professional courteous staff are there to meet and greet just like every other time we've stayed there.The rooms are quiet and comfortable,appointed with the amenites expected of a quality 4 star hotel.The excellent concierge service provides all the information you need for your stay in Chicago.Best location on North Michigan Avenue bar none.There is a full service restaurant and bar located in the Lobby and the Hotel is within safe walking distance of shops,restaurants, and bars too numerous to mention.The Westin Michigan Avenue overall is a no nonsense,professionally run,quality 4 star hotel.You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect night spent at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: mdm650
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had spent a long day shopping it was black Friday. When we arrived we were tired and the experience could not have been better. From the valet parking to the registration it was hassle free. The room was very nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. We will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: queen2010
Reviews.Content: Everything I requested was furnished. The cleaning attendants were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - but still disappointing”
Reviews.Author: phxtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Awesome Michigan Ave location, but the rooms felt sparse and a little dirty, And where is the original Heavenly Bed??? The bed was ok... but the new duvet they have feels like polyester. Also, the bathroom felt old too. With all the great hotels right in this area, I don't think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Westin Standards”
Reviews.Author: Pam-Roberts3
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at this Westin on November 19th and were deeply disappointed in the property. This is a very large Westin. It's tiny workout room had maybe 70% of the treadmills and elipticals functioning. People waited in line on a Saturday at 6:30 AM for a machine and gave up. My husband took to the stairways and ran up and down them in frustration. They were not clean. Our room was one of the renovated ones we had paid extra dollars for. It was a dissappointment for a Westin. This Westin is at best a mid-tier hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, above average prices”
Reviews.Author: Chailey_Paul
Reviews.Content: All very superficial> Looks good from the outside, public areas ok but rooms old and tired. Dont bother Chicago is well served with far better 4 star hotels than this.

Reviews.Title: “No-nonsense business hotel in the best part of town”
Reviews.Author: Tarvel2learn
Reviews.Content: Westin's defining feature is its excellent location. Right at the edge of the magnificient mile, its bang in the middle of where all the action is. The property itself is clean and well maintained. The rooms are reasonably sized and good value. I would recommend it to anyone visiting Chicago and wants an efficient, no-nonsense place to stay. The only element that it lacks is probably a bit of "personality"- some defining, individual characteristic.

Reviews.Title: “No tranquility at this Westin...”
Reviews.Author: candid87
Reviews.Content: Where to start?? Our suite wasn't available to us until 6:30pm. At 4pm they sent us out for a 30 minute wait which turned into 2.5 hours and left us hurriedly changing for our 5pm event in a temporary room down the hall. (They did offer us another better suite, but with no bed for our college aged daughter who was joining us.) It took 4 phone calls and a full day before the extra pillows were delivered. An all night party in a nearby room led a neighbor to scream at the top of his lungs at 3am. The coffee that we really needed was undrinkable due to a pot that didn't work properly. They did discount our room from $610 to $500, but given our experience, we won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: cobaltblue
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very centrally located with a lot of amenities. In the lobby, kids can play the wii and there is free wifi. The lobby is very soothing with green colors, fresh flowers and funky music. Starbucks is right in the lobby although they are not open for long hours. The room was amazing, clean, with nice terry bathrobe, the heavenly bed, amazing view of the beach.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin makes travel to Chicago an excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: olddiverdown
Reviews.Content: I have not traveled to Chicago in approximately 20 years, but, I got a chance to attend a conference at the Westin and could not have asked for a better place to stay. The stay was excellent in all areas of custome service. The rooms were spacious, clean and very, very comfortable. This Westin was located right in the middle of the Magnificent Mile and offered everything from dining to shopping. I would recommend this to anyone for either a business or private stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms in need of a reno...”
Reviews.Author: momon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days recently. Staff and check in were nice and efficient and friendly. Room was "ok". Bed was fine but overall the room was dated. The toilet would not flush properly and that got annoying after awhile. Also, the shower was horrible. The wireless internet would not work from the 6th floor - a bit frustrating. The Grill was a good place to go for drinks. They have a prime location here - it would be nice if the rooms were up to some of the other Westin's standards.

Reviews.Title: “Its more of a 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sportz_Fan12
Reviews.Content: Dont book it considering you get a 4-star hotel. I stayed there this weekend in a newly renovated room. Only positives i see are flat screen TV and marble slap in the bathroom. Nothing else is even close to a 4-star quality. I stay at WESTIN GALLERIA in dallas which is also a 4-star hotel and check out the pictures, you will see the difference. I will just say my stay was a disappointment. Location was the convenience. I really didnt like anything in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First time visit to this great city!”
Reviews.Author: GA_GAL13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin on Michigan Ave and it was fabulous. Great area to walk to lots of shops and restaurants. Felt totally comfortable despite the fact that I was travelling alone. Took a tour around the city! Fabulous time of year to visit also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: lvs2cruz
Reviews.Content: Had just a couple issues but overall a nice stay at the Westin. Check in was done in less than two minutes, got a good sized, clean room on the 14th floor for "preferred" guests, and the hotel itself is perfectly located to shopping and restaurants. My minor problems were getting the wifi to work, no newspaper unless you were willing to be down in the lobby by 7:30, and the temperatures of the meeting rooms which were either stiffling or so cold I had to run back to my room to get a jacket. I never did find a free pieceof equipment in their tiny exercise room either early morning or late at night, and I tried for three days. The other two issues were not the fault of the hotel -- sirens all night long which made sleeping difficult and a crazy taxi driver who did 85mph (no exaggeration) on the way to ORD, just missing a collision by inches and thank God there was a place to pull off the road. Anyway, I got the impression from hotel staff that they valued my business and I would certainly have no problem returning to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: JCJC29
Reviews.Content: Terrific staff at the Westin! The hotel was sold out and the staff still found time to make my staff very personal and enjoyable! Each at the Grill - great food! Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great ...staff not so great !!”
Reviews.Author: jod3303
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August during Lollapalooza, four of us shared 2 rooms. The hotel is in a great location, the quality of the rooms was good, apart from plastic cups in the bathroom, would expect glass for the prices they charge. The downside is the very very rude and unhlepful staff. There was a real mix up with our booking which to be fair was not the fault of the hotel but was due to a issue with our travel agent. However I would have hoped from a little help from the hotel, they could clealy see what the issue was from all the paperwork and communicationl with the agent but they basically didnt want to help at all, they eventually became super friendly when they spoke to the agent and the issues were sorted out, but it was so fake as they had been so rude 10 seconds before, we spent nearly an hour trying to get the issue sorted then suddenly all smiles and over the top help. However the moment had passed and we had lost faith in the hotel, they said that they would credit back the money that we had been over charged ( well in excess of $1150 per couple) , However when we got home and checked our bank account we found they had failed to credit us they had in fact taken the money again so we were now $2300 in arrears. We called the hotel who had suddenly lost their friendliness again and denied that they had done anything wrong, we had to get our bank to contact them and it finially took 5 days to get the money back. It was a nightmare, we felt let we were made out to be liars and just trying to rip them off. My biggest annoyance was the fact that when I aksed to speak to the General Manager I was told that they dont have a GM or assistant GM working on the weekends, I have never ever in all my years of staying in hotels around the world heard any any hotel that doesnt have a manager on duty at weekends. Sadly I therefore have to advise that if anything goes wrong dont expect them to offer any support or assistance.

Reviews.Title: “excellent but expensive”
Reviews.Author: balticbash
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff couldn't be more helpful. Superb position. Free internet in Business Center. However, hotel restuarant (The Rib Room) charges extortionate prices - I used it the first night because I was late arriving, but was horrified by the cost! First night noisy because of wedding party, but after that absolutely fine and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & location - overnight parking high”
Reviews.Author: Cubsdiva
Reviews.Content: My husband and our friends shared a room as we were in Chicago for the DMB show @ Wrigley. We got our room through Expedia and when we checked in they gave us a free upgrade to a room almost on the corner overlooking Water Tower & Michigan Avenue. It was a great location and the room was very nice and clean. A little tight on space but that is b/c we had 4 people in one room (2 queen beds). Our room had a connecting door to the next room and the people next to us were so loud in the morning. Seriously screaming to e/o was their normal volume just have a normal convo. It's crazy how people have no concept of their surroundings. My only issue was overnight parking was high $55 per night. When we checked out our friends already had paid for their parking but my husband was still charged for two cars. We are now dealing w/trying to get a refund - which is so fun :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ivoev
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of the Magnificent mile. Close to shopping, lake front. Great rooms and service

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful sltay”
Reviews.Author: travelbunny0659
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin on North Michigan Avenue in Chicago over the Labour Day Long weekend. We found the concierge extremely helpful. All the staff were wonderful. The bed waas great, the room was nice. It was close to everything and buying a CTA (Chicago Transport) pass was probably the best thing we ever did. We managed to go to the Lincoln Park Zoo (which is free), Chinatown and took into a Chicago Cubs game- and we took the Subway or bus everywhere we went - very convenient. We wouldn't have known about it if it wasn't for the concierge at the hotel. Everthing was very clean in the room and the coffee was replaced every day. We stayed three nights. The only drawback that I would say is the parking was a little high - $55/day. Other than that though we were very satisfied with our stay. The hotel even had umbrellas for us to use when it rained.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dangshmang
Reviews.Content: They made my stay in Chicago very pleasant. Close to the red line State/Chicago stope, to the 12th stop of the hop on hop off bus tour, located right off the Magnificent Mile shopping street, walking distance of fun bar's and restaurants, awesome fitness facilities, airport shuttle for $28 that runs every 35 minutes. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. They didn't have a business center but they did have computer/internet access where travelers could print up boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Not So Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lululouise
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend with my travel buddy/shopping partner. I booked one night with points and the other at a discounted rate, but the customer service rep wasn't able to merge the reservations so I had two separate confirmed codes. The location of this hotel is fabulous - next door to the John Hancock Building, right across the street from Bloomingdales and around the corner from Louis Vuitton. Great. However, the customer service and the room were less to be desired. I called ahead to let them know that we would be arriving after midnight - no problem. The person I spoke with was really nice confirmed that I wanted two beds and my credit card. When we arrived, the front desk staff person was friendly checked me in for both reservations- again, no problems. The room needed some repairs - the beds weren't as comfy as they usually, the bathroom toilet was not secured on the floor, there was mold on the bathroom ceiling, and the bathroom door paint was peeling. The next morning there was a bill on the door, which included a charge of $55 for parking. We didn't have a car, we took a cab from the airport! So, I stopped at the front desk, the woman was nice and credited the $55 to my account. I also mentioned that I had two separate reservations and asked if they can make sure the room gets cleaned, she said no problem. Later in the afternoon, we came back to drop off some bags. When we opened the door, the room wasn't clean. We left and went for more shopping - came back again before dinner. We went to open the door and were locked out! Neither of the door keys worked. So we had to go back downstairs, wait in line only to be told "you probably deactivated with your cell phone." Really? I don't think so. I asked to speak to a manager, who came out and apologized assured me that the keys weren't deactivated and offered me 4,000 SPG points. (Not on my account as of yet). Needless to say, I will not be staying here again. I agree with some of the other travelers - this is a Sheraton acting as Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, everything else average”
Reviews.Author: bumpsetspike12
Reviews.Content: My mother and i went to Chicago for 5 days to visit with my cousin and my aunt who live there. We decided to use our starwood points and stay here at the westin. The hotel was in a great central location, near the shops, parks, beaches, and most importantly, my cousins appartment. However, we had a few issues with the hotel itself... We specifically requested a room with a view of the lake, this was a problem at first seeing that when we walked into our room, all we could see was the building next door, which was the Hancock Tower, but still, not what we were looking for. They couldnt change our room until 1/2 way through our stay. However once we were in the room with a view, our attitudes didnt change much towards the hotel. The staff was very friendly and always willing to help. However some employees didnt understand how the starwood point system worked and there was a rather big misunderstanding with that. We thought we could use our points to treat ourselves to massages, this was false information. We would have never spent that much money if we were told so in the first place. Other things about starwood that werent mentioned to us......the hotel has no pool but there is a pool somewhere for hotel guests to use for free, we were unaware of this until our last day of stay. We also werent put on the starwood preferred guest floor which recieves special spa treatments and freshfruit every day. If we wanted to order fruit for our room, it would have costed somewhere around $18 if my math is correct, which frankly, is rediculus for a plate of fruit. There is also a shuttle from the hotel to and from Midway airport which we were unaware of. I dont know all the details but according to my mother they gave her a hard time when she complained about all of this at check out, even though it was their fault for not informing us about special amenities only permitted to starwood guests, which we are.

Reviews.Title: “MLB Teams”
Reviews.Author: MandyJ4
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! All the opposing teams that play the Cubs, stay here. Baseball players everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: 73Buckeye
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet room, with comfortable bedding and very nice amenities in the bathroom, including soaps, shampoos, conditioners and body wash. Competitive rates and friendly front desk staff. First stay in that hotel in many years, but would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: winsumwzl
Reviews.Content: my best friend and i stayed here for 3 nights over the weekend. it is not as nice as many westins, but has a wonderful location. we got two adjoining rooms on the 5th floor. when i got into my room i found pink gooey stuff spilled on the nightstand which i washed off, and after that we both got terribly allergic to SOMETHING in our rooms (later we noticed that some guests had dogs with them, so we figure that must have been the cause [note to hotel, in addition to smoke-free you might want to designate some rooms animal-free for us allergy sufferers]. the next morning the carpet outside out rooms was terribly dirty and so as we were leaving we mentioned something to the front desk staff and they said they would take care of it immediately. when we returned, not only had it not been 'taken care of' it was much worse--there were paper wrappings, tissue, a dirty Qtip, and a prescription pill among other garbage all down the hallway. we went down to the front desk and asked for the manager and he accompanied us upstairs. to his credit, he was appalled too. he said he would take care of it and gave us two $35 breakfast coupons (which we used for a nice--but pricey-- breakfast) since the housekeeping had been so lax and unresponsive to our requests. other things--the in-room coffeemaker in my room had obviously gotten a lot of use and there was coffee splashes on the wall beside the coffeemaker for all 3 days of our stay. the linens seemed to be clean and the rooms otherwise presentable, but some issues with getting the A/C adjusted, and the rooms aired out. overall, although i am a starwood member, i do not think i would stay here again, althought it was in a good location. the cleanliness was definitely an issue as well as the overall feel--a bit below what a westin should be.

Reviews.Title: “Undeniably impeccable hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarianaS64
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel is in the PERFECT location -- right on the Magnificent Mile! It is walking distance to the best restaurants, shopping and everything that downtown Chicago has to offer. The lobby is beautiful, aromatic, elegant and inviting. Our room was superb --we had a lovely view of Michigan Avenue on the 27th floor! It is truly an ideal hotel for business and leisure travelers. It was the perfect time to walk to Millennium Park and enjoy our surroundings. I recommend this fantastic hotel to everyone!! It is one of the best hotels in Chicago for good reason â™¥

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel for first time visitors to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: echobay15
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3 night stay with my husband, adult daughter and teenage son for the sole purpose of watching the Phillies and Cubs play baseball at Wrigley Field. We had a large beautiful corner room with a view of the city. Everyone from the doorman to the maids were friendly and helpful. We would especially like to thank our floor maid LaDawn for being so friendly and attentive to our needs. We would recommend your hotel to anyone. It was one of our best vacations ever.!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE the Michigan Ave Westin!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TulsaLisaD
Reviews.Content: We fell more in love with Chicago because of the Westin!!! Our room was perfect!!!! We had a view of the American Girl Store- so my daughters woke up every day in anticipation of getting to go shopping there!!! The location is amazing- we walked all over downtown and loved it!!! The doormen are so friendly and were playful with my kids! The beds are as heavenly as the hotel says they will be!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated for the price!”
Reviews.Author: chlsmiller
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. It's right next to the John Hancock building so the location is great. They allowed early check-in which was great. They did however fall short in several areas. They charged a fee for anything and everything that you may want or need. It was $13 a day for internet access... on top of the $300 a night charge!! There was no fridge in the room which meant eating out all three meals a day. They would place something in their refrigerator for a fee. Their charge for a bagel and cream cheese was $6! They had starbucks coffee that you could brew in the morning and that was nice. They had a real hair dryer instead of one of those wall mounted things. No pool which was disappointing. There were always people there to get the doors for you as long as you were entering the building, you were on your own if you were exiting. I spilled hot coffee on myself as we were leaving because no one would help me exit the building with my luggage. The consierge was knowledgeble regarding all the touristy spots but didn't have any other information. We sometimes like to eat at the local hot spots that are a little less traveled. They were also never at their desk and when we called we always had to leave a message and have them call us back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location !”
Reviews.Author: Gold2004
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Michigan Av, visiting Chicago for the first time. The location is fantastic, right on Michigan Avenue with the lakeside just minutes of walking from the hotel. We even had a wonderful lake-view, similar to what You could expect in a beach resort ! The rooms are quite average, but clean and well-kept. The staff at reception were very friendly, but the reception/lobby area is a bit small and crowded, especially when groups/parties check in or out at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “It's difficult to take trips elsewhere because we love this particular Westin so much and none other has compared.”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl0101
Reviews.Content: Our family has extensive experience in travel. The Westin Michigan Avenue is by far the best of the best. The first-rate service is a result of the amazing personnel. I felt like every 10 steps there was a friendly smile and a helping hand. They suggested we rent bikes and ride along the lakefront. We did, and it was a blast! Anytime we are unsure of what to do, we took a walk through the lobby and talked to the personnel. They know everything about anything. The rooms are so comfy. Lots of space, especially for a large city hotel room. There isn't a better view than Michigan Avenue, or a better city than Chicago. The architectural boat tour was amazing as well. What I liked the best- The Westin people! They function like a family. What I liked the least- Leaving Truly a great memory! Oh, and the bar has great martini's! Always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that is about it”
Reviews.Author: MurphyandZoe
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin for several nights while in Chicago for business. This was my first time staying at a Westin in Chicago - I 've stayed at Westin's in other cities and have found them to be generally comfortable - not this one however. When I initially checked into my room there was a dirty wine glass on the floor outside of my room and a half consumed pepsi in the garbage can by the desk.Two out of the three days that I stayed at the hotel I had to go to the front desk and ask to have mini-bar charges removed from my bill for items that I did not consume. The bed was made up with a flat sheet on the bottom and the sheet was too short. The bottom 12 " of the bare mattress was exposed and not a very comfortable feeling when trying to sleep. The tub and toilet did not drain properly and my towel had a large rip in it.. Two of the three elevators were broken the second day of my stay. Not the best experience compared to other Starwood Hotels. I've stayed at many other hotels while in Chicago for previous business trips that seemed to take better care in guest comfort. I don't think I'll be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Still waiting in the lobby...”
Reviews.Author: blistersoul
Reviews.Content: I would love to rate things like the room and cleanliness but we, after trying to check in numerous times, are still waiting in the lobby. We arrived just before the 3 o' clock check in time and were told to wait till our room would be ready at 3 pm. Now it as almost five and we are really getting to know their lobby. Last time we went through the line, which you have to do each time you want an update, we were told that they would check to see if our room was ready... That was at 4:30. I think time and light are relative in this Westin... At least the time of the guests which are unvalued under the time of the ever-present yet reliably unhelpful lobby staff. We've overheard others in the lobby with similar problems. One couples' room keys weren't working so they had to wait in the 15 minute line again. We're all getting quite good at waiting and hearing silly reasons why we can't check in yet. At least it gives me time to write this review for them. If you want to spend your vacation waiting around in a very nice lobby then this Westin is for you. Otherwise, try a Best Western or something where they actually know how to get their guests into the rooms they've.

Reviews.Title: “A Sheraton in Westins Clothingâ€™s”
Reviews.Author: ProSpotter
Reviews.Content: The location is everything that I liked about this hotel. Location is excellent. I love to stay at the Westins but this one was weak with their typical Westin amenities and service. Check in receptionist was very quiet and hardly spoke more than a few necessary words. The room was very small and did not seem up to date: tiny closet, narrow bathroom, no view. We stayed on one of the two SPG preferred club floors which offered a bowl of fruit near the elevator that was always empty. It was a room that shared a common door and we could hear our neighbors talking. Never saw any staff members other than a few in the lobby. There is also no pool at this location and we were told that we could use the pool at the Sheraton that was 13 blocks away....no thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Stay @ Westin Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: BUH_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 days for a business trip. The location is absolutely great. Didn't have a good start with the room but upon a complain to the front desk, the hotel's room director (Nurpur) went above and beyond to cater for my needs. She was very proactive in reaching out via emails and phones to make sure that they can get an unhappy customer to be a happy one. Overall, I would love to go back to the place if they change their carpets. Some how the one in my room wasn't very clean but I definitely liked their service; may be primarily because of this director who emphathized to my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: zitinia
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect,in the middle of all the action great restaurant on Rush str and nice shopping on Michigan ave. The room had a beautiful view to lake Michigan,the beds are unbelievable so comfy and cozy The stuff was very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay to enjoy and see all that Chicago has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: gbachle
Reviews.Content: The Westin is perfectly situated to enjoy the big city fun of being on Michigan Avenue. The hotel was so helpful to suggest and guide us to all of the multi-transportation opportunities available in Chicago. We parked our car in a parking lot away from the expensive parking downtown and never used it again until we left for home. The hotel was within walking distance to great restaurants. There is even a small beach just a few blocks from this hotel. The children loved it. There is a little bakery right across the street from the hotel that also serves breakfast. Also across from the hotel is a stop for the open top bus that gives you a wonderful over view of the city. We used the subways and buses to see the museums, pier, parks, and concerts. Our grand daughters went to American Girl (2 blocks away) and kept their dolls on the window sill looking out the window of their room so they could see us coming and going. We took the sunset sailboat from the pier one evening. We never ran out of things to do. The Westin was our home. The staff was so helpful and courteous, that my husband had his next work-related conference at the Westin on Michigan Avenue. The hotel even got them to a golf course. Everyone there raved about how easy and comfortable the hotel made everyone feel. It is our fav place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Le02010
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel location and the quality of the rooms. The front desk service is excellent. A little bit crowded during the summer. It is closed to the lake and in one of the most nicest areas of downtown chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Location”
Reviews.Author: charlotteharrop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Michigan Avenue for the 4th of July and had the most amazing time ever. The view from the view was outstanding. The service level of the staff was exceptional. I loved the fact that this was a Westin property. Definitely worth the visit and by far beats the hotels around it.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs”
Reviews.Author: alanp3p
Reviews.Content: I am a Platinum Starwood member for 12 years. I have stayed at this hotel many times only because of the location. I have found the service to be lacking, the staff to be indifferent and the cleanliness to be poor. This room was beyond just dirty. There were hundreds of little nat like bugs and a few moths in the room. I called down twice and they said each time they would take care of it but I could not see the results. When I called down a third time the Manager acted like it was a chore to be bothered. The Westin River North is a much better hotel but a few dollars more and my opinion not as good a location. But it is clean and has a friendly accommodating staff. I will walk a few extra blocks from now on and stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant, clean, and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: daisy0131
Reviews.Content: The room was huge, with a great view of the happenings of Michigan Ave, right in the center of it all. The bathroom was clean and elegant. The lounge was large and comfortable, and smelled wonderful. Though I have no idea of what. The concierge was very helpful, providing suggestions for restaurants that were not in our trip books. She was able to listen to our varied requests and pick a place we all loved. Overall, a great choice! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A spectacular stay right on Michigan Avenue”
Reviews.Author: TFocker
Reviews.Content: As you'd expect, the Westin is located right on Michigan Avenue in the middle of all the downtown action. The lobby is very stylish and always seems to have a pleasant scent. The staff is is very attentive and friendly, it feels like they truly care that you enjoy your stay. Our suite was on the 5th floor and overlooked Michigan Ave. The room was huge and the bathroom was very nice too. Everything was spotless and very neat in the room. There was a large flat screen TV and Bose radio. I can't think of too many hotels I've seen that have a Bose radio in the room! I was pleasantly surprised at how quiet the room was, given the proximity to one of the busiest streets I've ever seen. But a quiet night of sleep was enjoyed after a long day. Westin advertises their beds as being "heavenly" and they fit the description to a tee. I made a joke to the front desk that I was going to take the bed home because it was nicer than the one I have at home. As it turns out, you can actually buy the beds like they have in the room! Initially we planned to hit one of the famous pizza places for dinner, but discovered 2 hour waits everywhere we went. So we decided to go back to the hotel and try The Grill Restaurant inside the hotel and it was fantastic! We didn't have a reservation and had a group of 7 plus 2 kids and they were able to seat us within minutes. The portions were far more than one person could eat and the food was delicious. Once again, the staff went out of their way to ensure our satisfaction. . Again, a great choice and unexpected hidden gem of sorts. I travel a lot for business and am so used to the generic level of service at most hotels, but the Westin really opened my eyes to how much nicer it is to stay in an upscale hotel. There are plenty of choices when it comes to hotels in the city, but for my money, it will be Westin every time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: kclay70
Reviews.Content: The Westin Michigan Avenue is a great choice for travelers visiting Chiciago for several reasons. The first is that is it on Michigan Avenue, right in the heart of everything. Walking and cabs are always an option as is the L train. The hotel itself is beautiful with large rooms, extremely comfortable beds and one of the friendliest staffs I've ever encountered. I'm a seasoned traveler as I travel for work regularly and this was definitely one of the most pleasant stays I've ever had. Special thanks to the staff and hotel for giving me a great experience and weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely atmosphere with a dedicated staff.”
Reviews.Author: haisu_sacai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my favourites in Chicago! There has only been one incident which annoyed me and I must say that they took care of it in a very gracious and professional manner the minute I complained about it. To me, that makes all the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: bogielz
Reviews.Content: I recommended the Westin Michigan Ave to my sister, who came in for a business trip, because of it's convenient location not only to all the great shopping, but close proximity to great restaurants on Rush St, and the beach. Check-in was painless, the room was very nice, comfy bed, nice bathroom with good products. It has a fresh clean look in the lobby and rooms, although the hallways seem a bit drab. Best of all, the rate was better than some of the old, tired hotel in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most Westin hotels”
Reviews.Author: Ariel_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several Westin hotels for business all over the US and The Westin Michigan Avenue was without a doubt the most pleasant and luxurious stay. The location on Michigan Avenue is perfect for great views of Chicago, shops and restaurants. The lobby of the hotel is plush and elegant and doesn't make you feel like you're in a businessman's hotel like most other Westins do. The staff were extremely helpful and gracious and went out of their way to offer us great service once they found out that I was staying on Starwood Preferred Guest points. Like most big city hotels though, the rooms are a little cramped...but since the best sights in Chicago are right outside the hotel's entrance, there is very little reason to spend too much time inside your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Long Weekend in Chicago, Largely Westin”
Reviews.Author: AGirlsGottaTravel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Westin over Memorial Day weekend, and couldnâ€™t have asked for better service. Because we got the first flight in to Chicago that day, we arrived at the hotel around 9 am, six hours before our check in time. We were expecting to drop off our bags and return later, however, our room was ready and we were able to check in that early. That was the first of many great interactions with the hotel staff: from the front desk, to the concierge (who scored us a same-day reservation on a boat tour around Chicago - rare because of the volume of tourists in the city for the Holiday), to the housekeeping and room service staff, our experience was thoroughly enjoyable. We've always been Westin fans, but this stay exceeded all expectations. Big kudos to the General Manager and his staff. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing (destroyed my trust in Westin Hotel brand)”
Reviews.Author: 1415HenryFive
Reviews.Content: While this hotel has a very good location the guest experience is a bit of a lottery at best. The hotel was built in the 1960s and though some money has been spent on it updating , it is not enough by far. We moved room in effect 3 times and this gave an insight into the poor quality of some of the rooms with very small bathrooms (it would be a joke to call any heavenly) and the room we ended up in with very low water presure in the shower and with black masking tape around the edge of the windows (looked like orginal 60's windows).The internet access did not work in the rooms and the towls where tired at best. The lifts also at times seemed to have a life of their own. The hotel staff where a mixture of the good and those who did not seem to have a clue what they where doing. Some smiled some looked pretty misreable it was all very random.I got the impression they where spread too thin. This hotel is in effect destroying a little bit of the Westin Brand every day its doors are open. I would avoid staying at this hotel unless you get a three star hotel price for your time at the hotel. This hotel has destroyed my trust in the Westin Brand.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with superior service.”
Reviews.Author: petlady99
Reviews.Content: Fix the drapes in room 1120 so they are all attaached. It was still functional just looked off. Add mouthwash to room supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Shopping location!”
Reviews.Author: Duchas
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fantastic location for shopping! Slap bang on the golden mile! Chicago has beautiful architecture and is very clean. Found it better as a shopping destination than the traditional NYC as an Irish shopper! The rooms are comfortable and the staff very accommodating! Having said that Ireland itself has since become more affordable thus US trips are now less encouraging! Overall though a great hotel!
